sub-subparagraph.text: Is organized for social purposes;
Has been incorporated for at least 1 year prior to the application for licensure;
Has at least 75 members;
Prepares and serves meals during regular operating hours to members and their guests;
Is located in the 14th election district or wherever else is permitted in the county; and
Has made capital expenditures for structures, improvements, equipment, and furnishings used in the private country club in an amount not less than $500,000.

subparagraph.text: An application for the special 7–day Class C (private country club) on–sale beer, wine and liquor license shall be made by 3 officers of the private country club, of whom at least 2 are residents of Frederick County.
The licensee may keep for sale and sell at retail alcoholic beverages to members and guests of the private country club for on–premises consumption only in the structures and surrounding grounds.
The hours of sale under a special 7–day Class C (private country club) on–sale beer, wine and liquor license are the same as for a Class C beer, wine and liquor license in the county.
There is a special Class C (Maryland Ensemble Theatre) on–sale beer and wine license.
On approval by the Board of License Commissioners of Frederick County of the license application, the Board shall issue a license for the Maryland Ensemble Theatre.
The annual license fee is $100.
The licensee may store for sale and sell beer and wine to the public.
The beer and wine shall be consumed on the premises not earlier than 1 hour before and not later than 1 hour after:

sub-subparagraph.text: A regular performance; or
A special fund–raiser performance exclusively for the benefit of the Maryland Ensemble Theatre.

subparagraph.text: The president and two other officers of Maryland Ensemble Theatre shall sign the application for the license filed on behalf of the Maryland Ensemble Theatre.
Two of the signatories from Maryland Ensemble Theatre shall be residents of Frederick County.
This subsection applies only in Garrett County.
In this subsection, “guest” means an individual who is specifically invited by a member of a club or organization where the member of the club or organization is in attendance.
There is a club and organization license.

sub-subparagraph.text: The annual license fee is $1,500.
The issuing fee for a new license is $1,500, in addition to the annual fee.

subparagraph.text: The license permits the sale on the premises only of beer, wine, and liquor to the members and the guests of the clubs and organizations.
The license shall be issued only to the following clubs and organizations:

sub-subparagraph.text: A bona fide nationally chartered nonprofit organization or club which has been incorporated for a period of not fewer than 5 years immediately prior to the filing of the application, composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States in any war in which the United States has engaged, which organization or club operates solely for the use of its own members and its guests when accompanied by such members, and meets in a clubhouse principally used for a club, and is neither directly nor indirectly operated as a public business.

Any lodge or chapter of a bona fide nonprofit and nationally chartered fraternal organization composed of members duly elected and initiated in accordance with the rites and customs of the fraternal organizations which is operating a home or clubhouse for the use of its members, and is neither directly nor indirectly operated as a public business. The club or organization shall have 100 or more bona fide members paying such dues as required by its national organization in the year immediately preceding the year in which the license is issued. The home or clubhouse shall have facilities for preparing and serving food on the premises to the members and their guests.
A bona fide yacht or boat club, owning real estate in the county and having a dues–paying membership of not less than 150 persons, not less than 50 of whom own yachts, boats, or other vessels.

A country club which has 75 or more bona fide members paying dues of not less than $40 per annum per member, which maintains at the time of the application for license a regular or championship golf course of 9 holes or more, or, in lieu of that golf course, a swimming pool at least 20 by 40 feet in size, and at least six tennis courts.

Before issuing any license pursuant to this paragraph, the Liquor Control Board shall determine whether the business to be operated by the prospective licensee is likely to enhance the recreational, business, and economic development of the county. If the Liquor Control Board in its discretion determines that the issuance of such a license will not enhance such development within the county, it shall reject the application for the license.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Harford County.

The Liquor Control Board may issue 6–day (Monday through Saturday) and 7–day Class C–1, Class C–2, and Class C–3 (on–sale) organization or club beer, wine and liquor licenses in accordance with this section.

A license issued under this subsection authorizes the holder of the license to sell or provide alcoholic beverages only for on–premises consumption by the members and guests of the club or organization.

subparagraph.text: In this paragraph, “war veterans organization” means a bona fide nationally chartered nonprofit organization or club that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has been incorporated for a period of not fewer than 5 years immediately before the filing of the application for a license under this paragraph;
Is composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States in any war in which the United States was engaged;
Operates solely for the use of its own members and its guests when accompanied by such members;
Meets in a clubhouse principally used for a club; and
Is neither directly nor indirectly operated as a public business.

subparagraph.text: A Class C–1 license may be issued only to a war veterans organization.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–1 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 50 to 99 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 6–day, Monday through Saturday, (on–sale) Class C–1 license is $350.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–1 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 50 to 99 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 7–day (on–sale) Class C–1 license is $450.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–1 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 100 to 250 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 6–day, Monday through Saturday, (on–sale) Class C–1 license is $600.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–1 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 100 to 250 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 7–day (on–sale) Class C–1 license is $700.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–1 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 251 to 450 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 6–day, Monday through Saturday, (on–sale) Class C–1 license is $850.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–1 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 251 to 450 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 7–day (on–sale) Class C–1 license is $950.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–1 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 451 or more bona fide members, the annual fee for a 6–day, Monday through Saturday, (on–sale) Class C–1 license is $1,000.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–1 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 451 or more bona fide members, the annual fee for a 7–day (on–sale) Class C–1 license is $1,100.
In this paragraph, “fraternal organization” means a lodge or chapter of a bona fide nationally chartered fraternal organization that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Is composed of members duly elected and initiated in accordance with the rites and customs of the organization;
Operates a clubhouse or building:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: For the use of its members; and
That has facilities for preparing and serving food on the premises for the members and their guests;

sub-subparagraph.text: Is neither directly nor indirectly operated as a public business; and
Has at least 100 bona fide members, each of whom paid dues as required by the national organization in the year immediately preceding the year for which the license was applied or issued.

subparagraph.text: A Class C–2 license may be issued only to a fraternal organization.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–2 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 100 to 250 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 6–day, Monday through Saturday, (on–sale) Class C–2 license is $800.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–2 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 100 to 250 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 7–day (on–sale) Class C–2 license is $900.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–2 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 251 to 450 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 6–day, Monday through Saturday, (on–sale) Class C–2 license is $1,050.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–2 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 251 to 450 bona fide members, the annual fee for a 7–day (on–sale) Class C–2 license is $1,150.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–2 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 451 or more bona fide members, the annual fee for a 6–day, Monday through Saturday, (on–sale) Class C–2 license is $1,200.

For a club or organization that qualifies for a Class C–2 license under this paragraph and has a membership of 451 or more bona fide members, the annual fee for a 7–day (on–sale) Class C–2 license is $1,300.
In this paragraph the following words have the meanings indicated.

sub-subparagraph.text: “Miscellaneous organization or club” means a country club, a yacht or boat club, or topiary garden.
“Country club” means a club or organization that:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: May be operated for profit or not for profit;
Has 75 or more bona fide members each of whom pays not less than $50 per year; and

Maintains at the time of the application for the license and continues to maintain a regular or championship golf course of 9 holes or more, or, instead of the golf course, a swimming pool at least 20 by 40 feet in size.

sub-subparagraph.text: “Topiary garden” means an organization that:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: Operates a public museum and garden for its membership and the general public as guests of the membership;
Is open to the general public for at least 6 days a week for at least 6 hours a day during 5 months each year; and
Has food preparation facilities on the topiary garden premises for the convenience of visiting guests.

sub-subparagraph.text: “Yacht or boat club” means a club or organization that:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: May be operated for profit or not for profit;
Owns real property in Harford County; and
Has not less than 150 bona fide dues–paying members and not less than 50 of whom own a yacht, boat, or other vessel.

subparagraph.text: A Class C–3 license may be issued only to a miscellaneous organization or club.

sub-subparagraph.text: The fee for a 6–day, Monday through Saturday, (on–sale) Class C–3 license under this paragraph is $1,300.
The fee for a 7–day Class C–3 license under this paragraph is $1,400.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Howard County.

subparagraph.text: There is a country club license.
The annual license fee is $1,500.

The license may be issued to a country club or to its owner or owners, regardless of whether the club is operated for profit or not. The club shall have a bona fide annual limited membership and shall have at the time of issuance of the license a regular or championship golf course adjacent to the premises for which a license is sought of 18 holes and other club facilities.
There is a veterans’ club license.
The annual license fee is $250.

The license may be issued to a club composed exclusively of members who served in the armed forces of the United States, which is affiliated with a national organization, and having 75 or more bona fide members paying such dues as required by its national organization in the year immediately preceding the year for which the license is issued. At least 75 percent of the members of the club shall have resided in Howard County for at least 2 years immediately preceding the date of application for the license and the club shall have maintained a post in the county for at least 3 years preceding the date of the application.
There is a conference center license.
The annual license fee is $700.

The license may be issued to a conference center or to its owner or owners, whether or not operated for profit, having not less than 7,000 square feet of conference area with accommodations, equipment, and facilities designed for holding meetings, seminars and conferences.
There is a police officers’ local affiliate license.
The annual license fee is $500.
The license may be issued to a local affiliate of an international organization of police officers.
To qualify for the license, a local affiliate shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: Have at least 100 dues paying members; and
Charge each member at least $15 a month in dues.

subparagraph.text: The local affiliate shall operate the clubhouse where the license is to be in effect solely for its own members and their guests.

paragraph.text: This section applies only in Kent County.
The annual license fee is $500.

subparagraph.text: There is an organization or club license.
The license may be issued to a bona fide nonprofit organization or club composed solely of members:

sub-subparagraph.text: That operates solely for the use of its own members and their guests when accompanied by such members;
That meets in a clubhouse that is used for no other purpose; and
That has 100 or more bona fide members paying such dues as were required in the year immediately preceding the year for which such license is issued.

subparagraph.text: For clubs composed exclusively of members who served in the armed forces of the United States, which are affiliated with a national organization, a license may be issued provided the club has 50 or more bona fide members paying the dues required by its national organization for the full year immediately preceding the year for which the license is issued.
The license permits the consumption of alcoholic beverages both on and off of the premises.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Montgomery County.

subparagraph.text: There is a country club license.
The annual license fee is $2,000.
The license shall be issued only to a country club:

sub-subparagraph.text: Which has 100 or more bona fide members of whatever class;
Whose members pay an annual total amount of dues which averages at least $50 for each member; and

Which maintains at the time of the application for the license a regular or championship golf course of nine holes or more. However, any licensed premises which had a Class C beer, wine and liquor license on January 1, 1964 is not required to maintain a regular or championship golf course if it then maintained and continues to maintain, in lieu thereof, a swimming pool at least 20 by 40 feet in size and at least six lawn tennis courts.

subparagraph.text: The licensee may keep for sale and sell any alcoholic beverages purchased from the Liquor Control Board for Montgomery County, at retail, to any customer at the place described in the license, for consumption on its premises only.
The application shall be signed by at least one officer of the club who shall be a resident or registered voter or taxpayer of Montgomery County.

A licensee under paragraph (2) of this subsection may keep for sale and sell at the place described in the license any alcoholic beverages purchased from the Liquor Control Board, at retail, for consumption on its premises only, to any member of the country club, to a bona fide guest or guests of a member, to the immediate family of a member, or to persons residing temporarily in the clubhouse of the country club.

In this paragraph “bona fide guest or guests of a member” includes, but is not limited to, any person 21 years of age or over with respect to the sale of all alcoholic beverages while the person is in attendance at a recognized national or regional athletic event being held on the premises of the licensee when:

sub-subparagraph.text: The licensee has made application to the Board of License Commissioners for permission to sell alcoholic beverages to persons attending a national or regional athletic event to be held on the premises of the licensee;
The application has been made at least 60 days prior to the date that the specific athletic event is to take place; and
The Board has granted the permission requested in the application.

subparagraph.text: An employee of the country club may not have guests at the country club for the purpose of the consumption of alcoholic beverages during the employee’s normal working hours.

Any corporation, club, or organization which is a country club as defined in this subsection or eleemosynary and is a local post, chapter, lodge, council, or branch of a national organization having a membership of more than 300,000 and which local post, chapter, lodge, council, or branch has a minimum dues–paying membership of more than 200 members may, upon receiving this license, allow alcoholic beverages to be consumed on its premises.

This license permits the consumption of alcoholic beverages by a bona fide member or his guest on the premises of the country club or eleemosynary corporation, club, or organization if the alcoholic beverages are supplied by a bona fide member.
The annual license fee is $300.
There is a veterans’ license.
The annual license fee is $1,000.
The license may be issued to any local unit of a nationwide bona fide nonprofit organization composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has a charter from a national veterans’ organization and is in existence and operating in Montgomery County prior to the time of making application for the license;
Has a bona fide membership of not less than 200 persons;
Has dues of not less than $5 per person; and

Owns or operates, solely for the use of its own members and their guests when accompanied by members, a clubhouse principally used for no other purpose, and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

subparagraph.text: The licensee may keep for sale and sell at retail any alcoholic beverages to any member or guest when accompanied by a member and is subject to all other provisions of this article relating to beer, wine and liquor licenses, Class C, in force in Montgomery County, except the provisions requiring the maintenance of a championship golf course. This license solely authorizes the sale and consumption on premises only.
There is a fraternal/sororal/service license.
The annual license fee is $1,000.
The license may be issued to any local unit of a lodge or chapter of any bona fide nonprofit and nationwide fraternal, sororal, or service organization that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Is composed solely of members duly elected and initiated in accordance with the rites and customs of that fraternal, sororal, or service organization;
Is in existence and operating in Montgomery County prior to the time of making application for a license;
Has a bona fide membership of not less than 200 persons and dues of not less than $5 per year per person; and

Owns and operates a clubhouse principally for the use of its members and their guests when accompanied by members and for no other purpose, and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

subparagraph.text: A licensee may keep for sale and sell at retail any alcoholic beverages to any member or guest when accompanied by a member.

The licensee is subject to all of the provisions of this article relating to beer, wine and liquor licenses, Class C, in force in Montgomery County, except the provisions requiring the maintenance of a championship golf course.
This license solely authorizes the sale and consumption on premises only.
There is a Takoma Park veterans’ license, which may be referred to as a Class C–TP license.
The annual license fee is $1,000. A Class C–TP licensee may not be charged for such a license until May 1, 1998.

The license may be issued to any local unit located in that portion of the City of Takoma Park that was formerly part of Prince George’s County of a nationwide bona fide nonprofit organization or club that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Is composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States in any war in which the United States has engaged;
Has a charter from a national veterans’ organization prior to the time of making application for the license;
Has a bona fide membership of not less than 100 persons and dues of not less than $5 per year per person;
Operates solely for the use of its own members and their guests when accompanied by such members;

Possessed a club license originally issued by the Prince George’s County Board of License Commissioners when the club was located in that portion of the City of Takoma Park that was formerly part of Prince George’s County; and
Meets in a clubhouse principally used for no other purpose.

subparagraph.text: There is a Continuing Care Retirement Community license.
The annual license fee is $500.
The license may be issued to a club that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Is composed of residents of a continuing care retirement community that has obtained a certificate of registration from the State Department of Aging under Title 10, Subtitle 4 of the Human Services Article;
Has at least 50 bona fide members; and
Has annual dues that average at least $5 per member.

subparagraph.text: A licensee may keep for sale and sell at retail to a member or a guest when accompanied by a member at the place described in the license beer, wine and liquor, purchased from the Department of Liquor Control for Montgomery County, for consumption on the licensed premises only.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Prince George’s County.

subparagraph.text: There is a veterans’ license.
The annual license fee is $910.
The license shall be issued to any local unit of a nationwide bona fide nonprofit organization or club that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Is composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States in any war in which the United States has engaged;
Has a charter from a national veterans’ organization prior to the time of making application for the license;
Has a bona fide membership of not less than 100 persons and dues of not less than $5 per year per person;
Operates solely for the use of its own members and their guests when accompanied by such members; and
Meets in a clubhouse principally used for no other purpose.

subparagraph.text: The licensee is subject to all other provisions of this article relating to beer, wine and liquor licenses, Class C, in force and effect in Prince George’s County.
There is a fraternal/sororal/service license.
The annual license fee is $910.
A license may be issued to any local unit of a lodge or chapter of any bona fide nonprofit and nationwide fraternal or service organization that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Is composed solely of members duly elected and initiated in accordance with the rites and customs of the fraternal, sororal, or service organization;
Is in existence and operating in Prince George’s County prior to the time of making application for the license;
Has a bona fide membership of not less than 100 persons and dues of not less than $5 per year per person; and
Owns or operates a home or clubhouse principally for the use of its members and their guests when accompanied by the members, and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

subparagraph.text: The licensee may keep for sale and sell at retail any alcoholic beverages to any member or guest when accompanied by a member for consumption on the licensed premises.

The licensee is subject to all the provisions of this article relating to beer, wine and liquor licenses, Class C, in force and effect in Prince George’s County, except that restrictions on the sale of alcoholic beverages on Sunday found in § 11–517 of this article and elsewhere do not apply.

The licensee may permit persons who have leased a private room or other area of the licensed premises for a private social gathering to bring beer, wine, and liquor onto the licensed premises, provided that it is consumed on the premises.
There is a special Class C (yacht club) license in Prince George’s County.
The annual license fee is $1,575.
A license may be issued to a yacht club that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has 50 or more bona fide members paying dues of not less than $75 per year per member;
Maintains at the time of application for the license a clubhouse with a seating capacity sufficient to accommodate at one time at least 100 persons;
Has slips or berths for 75 boats or more; and
Has at least 5 acres of ground.

subparagraph.text: The licensee may keep for sale and sell at retail any alcoholic beverages, to any member or guest when accompanied by a member at the place described in the license.
Alcoholic beverages may be consumed on the licensed premises only.

The licensee is subject to all the provisions of this article relating to beer, wine and liquor licenses, Class C, in force and effect in Prince George’s County. Restrictions on the sale of alcoholic beverages on Sunday found in § 11–517 of this article and elsewhere do not apply.

The application for license filed on behalf of any such yacht club shall be signed by at least one officer of the club, who shall be a resident, registered voter, and taxpayer of Prince George’s County.
There is a special Class C (golf and country club) license.
The annual license fee is $1,815.
The license may be issued to any golf and country club that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: 200 or more bona fide members paying dues of not less than $75 per year per member; and
Maintains at the time of application for the license two or more tennis courts, a swimming pool at least 30 by 80 feet in size, and a regular or championship golf course of 9 holes or more; or

sub-subparagraph.text: Has:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: 500 or more bona fide dues–paying members; and
Maintains at the time of the application for the license a regular or championship golf course of 18 holes or more.

subparagraph.text: The licensee may keep for sale and sell at retail any alcoholic beverages, to any customer at the place described in the license.
The alcoholic beverages may be consumed on or off its premises.
The application for the license shall be signed by at least one officer of the club, who shall be a resident, registered voter, and taxpayer.

sub-subparagraph.text: The license is subject to all the provisions of this article.

Any restrictions against the sale of alcoholic beverages on Sundays, appearing elsewhere in this article, do not apply to any licensee holding the special Class C (golf and country club) license. Sales on Sunday under the license shall be made only to the bona fide members of the golf and country club and to guests of those members for consumption on the premises and the grounds of the club used in connection with the club.

subparagraph.text: There is a special Class C (country club) license.
The annual license fee is $1,100.

The license may be issued to a country club meeting the requirements specified in paragraph (5) of this subsection other than the requirements for a regular or championship golf course of 9 holes or more. Instead, the club shall have, in addition to the other requirements, not less than 15 acres of ground for the licensed premises and used in connection therewith. Licensees are subject to restrictions appearing in § 11–517 of this article as to sale of alcoholic beverages on Sunday.
Alcoholic beverages may not be consumed off their premises or on the grounds of the club.
There is a special Class C (concession) beer, wine and liquor license.

The annual license fee is $1,815. The fee shall be paid prior to its issuance, regardless of any terms or conditions in any contractual agreement between the concessionaire and Prince George’s County.

The license may be issued to any person operating a concession subject to contractual agreement with Prince George’s County on the premises of any golf and country club or country club owned by Prince George’s County.
The concessionaire holding this license may keep for sale and sell at retail any alcoholic beverages by the drink or the bottle for consumption on the premises only.
The concessionaire may be any natural person, association, firm, partnership, or corporation approved as such by the County Council and shall be a resident of the State of Maryland.
The Board shall regulate the manner of dispensing alcoholic beverages, and shall authorize the number of outlets permitted to dispense alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Queen Anne’s County.
The annual license fee is $500.
The license shall be issued only to:

subparagraph.text: A bona fide nonprofit organization or club composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States in any war in which the United States has engaged and which organization or club operates solely for the use of its own members and their guests when accompanied by such members; and

A bona fide yacht club, golf club, fraternal club or order, country club, and/or social or recreational club, which is not operated for profit, and which has had for one year, immediately preceding the year for which the license is issued, 50 or more bona fide adult members paying dues of not less than $20 per annum, owning or operating a clubhouse or meeting rooms having facilities for preparing and serving food on the premises which are principally used for members and their guests, when accompanied by members, and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

paragraph.text: This license permits the consumption of alcoholic beverages both on and off the licensed premises.
This subsection applies only in St. Mary’s County.
The annual license fee is $350.
This license may be issued to a bona fide nonprofit organization or club:

subparagraph.text: That is composed solely of members who have served in the armed forces of the United States in any war in which the United States has engaged;
That operates solely for the use of:

sub-subparagraph.text: Its members; and
A member’s guest, provided the guest is accompanied by the member; and

subparagraph.text: If the club or organization meets in a clubhouse principally used for a club and is neither directly nor indirectly operated as a public business.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Somerset County.
The annual license fee is $316.
There is a yacht or golf and country club license. The licensee shall:

subparagraph.text: Have a bona fide membership of not less than 30 persons;
Charge dues of not less than $20 annually for each adult member; and
Own and operate a clubhouse on premises principally used for no other purpose and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

paragraph.text: There is a fraternal or sororal license. The licensee shall:

subparagraph.text: Be a lodge or chapter of a bona fide nonprofit and nationwide fraternal or sororal organization composed of members duly elected and initiated in accordance with the rites and customs of such fraternal or sororal organization;
Have been in existence and operating in the county for a period of not less than 1 year prior to the time of making application for the license;
Have a bona fide membership of not less than 25 persons;
Charge dues of not less than $15 annually for each member; and
Own or operate a home or clubhouse principally for the use of its members and their guests when accompanied by such members, and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

paragraph.text: There is a veterans’ license. The licensee shall:

subparagraph.text: Be a local unit of a nationwide bona fide nonprofit organization or club composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States in any war in which the United States has engaged;
Have held a charter from a national veterans’ organization for a period of not less than 1 year prior to the time of application for licensing;
Have a bona fide membership of not less than 35 persons;
Charge dues of not less than $4 annually for each member; and

Own or operate a home or clubhouse which the organization or club operates solely for the use of its members and their guests when accompanied by such members and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

paragraph.text: Each licensee shall purchase all wines and liquors sold by the licensee from the Somerset County Liquor Control Board. The licensee shall be charged the invoice price charged to the Liquor Control Board, plus freight charges and a sum not to exceed 20 percent of the aggregate invoice price and freight charges.
This subsection applies only in Talbot County.
The annual license fee is $250.
A license shall be issued only to a club:

subparagraph.text: Which is not operated for profit;
Which has had for 5 consecutive years, immediately preceding the year for which the license is issued, 50 or more bona fide members; and
Whose members pay dues of not less than $10 annually.

paragraph.text: In the case of clubs composed exclusively of members who served in the armed forces of the United States, which are affiliated with a national organization, the license may be issued if the club had 50 or more bona fide members paying whatever dues that were required by its national organization in the year immediately preceding the year for which the license is issued.
Section 18–101 of this article permits the Talbot County Council to provide for the retail alcoholic beverage laws for the county which, if enacted, supersede the provisions of this article.
This subsection applies only in Washington County.
The annual license fee is:

subparagraph.text: $500 for clubs with less than 600 members (including social members); and
$1,000 for clubs with 600 or more members (including social members).
There is a special Class C golf and country club license. Upon the approval by the Board of License Commissioners, it shall be issued to any golf and country club in the county which:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has 200 or more bona fide members paying dues of not less than $30 per annum per member, whether or not the club is operated for profit; and
Maintains a regular or championship golf course of 9 holes or more.
The licensee may keep for sale and sell at retail any alcoholic beverages to bona fide members of the club and their guests at the place described in the license.
Alcoholic beverages may be consumed only on the premises and grounds of the club.
The annual license fee for a golf and country club license is $1,000 for the license year commencing in May of each year.
The application for a license filed on behalf of any such golf and country club shall be signed by 3 officers of the club.

A golf and country club license shall be subject to all the provisions of this article and shall include all of the privileges and restrictions applicable thereunder to Class C license holders in Washington County.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Wicomico County.

subparagraph.text: The annual license fee for a 6–day license is as follows:

sub-subparagraph.text: For a club with 50 to 399 bona fide, dues–paying members – $275;
For a club with 400 to 599 such members – $550; and
For a club with 600 or more members – $825.

subparagraph.text: The license fee shall be established on the maximum number of dues–paying members during the calendar year immediately preceding the application for a license.
The annual license fee for a 7–day license is as follows:

sub-subparagraph.text: For a club with 50 to 399 bona fide, dues–paying members – $400;
For a club with 400 to 599 of those members – $675; and
For a club with 600 or more members – $950.

subparagraph.text: The license may be issued to a bona fide, nonprofit fraternal, social, or veterans’ club which:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has been incorporated for a period of not less than 5 years immediately prior to the filing of the application;
Is in a clubhouse or premises used principally for a club and neither directly nor indirectly operated as a public business;

Has had at least 100 bona fide, dues–paying members during the one year immediately prior to the filing of the application, except that if the club is composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States, a minimum of 50 such members is sufficient; and
Has facilities for preparing and serving food on the premises to the members and their guests.

subparagraph.text: This license for a club permits consumption on the premises only.

paragraph.text: All alcoholic beverages, other than beer and light wine, sold or offered for sale shall be purchased from the Liquor Control Board, and each bottle shall be stamped or otherwise designated “on–sale only” by the Board.
This subsection applies only in Worcester County.

subparagraph.text: The annual license fee for a six–day license is $500; and
The annual license fee for a seven–day license is $750.
There is a golf, tennis, or swimming club license which is used in conjunction with a country club, excluding miniature golf courses operating in Worcester County.
The club shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: Have been incorporated for a period of not less than one year prior to the time of making application for the license;
Have a bona fide membership of not less than 100 persons and dues of not less than $10 per year per adult member;
Have facilities for preparing and serving food on the premises to members and their guests when accompanied by members; and
Own or operate a clubhouse on premises principally used for no other purpose and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

subparagraph.text: There is a veterans’ license.

The license may be issued to any local unit of a nationwide bona fide nonprofit organization or club composed solely of members who served in the armed forces of the United States in any war in which the United States has engaged which:

sub-subparagraph.text: Has held a charter from a national veterans’ organization for a period of not less than 5 years prior to the time of making application for the license;
Has a bona fide membership of not less than 15 persons and dues of not less than $5 per year per person;
Operates solely for the use of its own members and their guests when accompanied by members; and
Meets in a clubhouse principally used for no other purpose.

subparagraph.text: There is a fraternal/sororal/service license.
The license may be issued to any lodge or chapter of any bona fide nonprofit and nationwide fraternal or service organization which:

sub-subparagraph.text: Is composed of members duly elected and initiated in accordance with the rites and customs of the fraternal or service organization;
Is in existence and operating in Worcester County for a period of not less than 5 years prior to the time of making application for the license;
Has a bona fide membership of not less than 40 persons and dues of not less than $5 per year per member; and
Owns or operates a home or clubhouse principally for the use of its members and their guests when accompanied by members, and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

subparagraph.text: There is a fishing club license.
The license may be issued to any club that is organized to promote the sport of fishing and that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Owns its own building;
Has been in existence for at least 5 years prior to making application for the license;
Has a bona fide membership of not less than 25 persons and dues of not less than $25 per year per adult member;
Operates solely for the use of its own members and their guests, when accompanied by a member; and
Meets in a clubhouse used principally for no other purpose, and not directly or indirectly owned or operated as a public business.

paragraph.text: Upon payment of the license fee, any applicant enumerated in this subsection may obtain the license from the Board.

subparagraph.text: Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, every licensee shall purchase all wines and liquors, except light wine and beer, sold by them from the dispensaries of the Worcester County Department of Liquor Control. The licensee shall receive at least a 15 percent discount from the retail sales price or any special sale price or discount price, whichever is lower. All licensees may purchase beer and light wine from licensed wholesalers.
Beginning on May 1, 2016, a licensee may elect to purchase wine and liquor from a licensed wholesaler under § 15–204(e) of this article.
For the purpose of qualifying for a seven–day license, clubs defined in this subsection shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: Have an enclosed dining area that has a seating capacity for 60 or more persons;
Serve full–course meals from menus at least twice daily; and
During the effective period of the license have daily average receipts from the sale of food in excess of those for the sale of alcoholic beverages.

subparagraph.text: The annual fee for a seven–day license is $300.

paragraph.text: “Bottle club” means any club or organization:

subparagraph.text: Which serves, sells, gives, or dispenses alcoholic beverages to its members or guests;
Which keeps for its members or guests any alcoholic beverages;
Which allows to be consumed on its premises any alcoholic beverages, by its members or guests, which beverages have been reserved by or purchased from the club by the members or guests;
At which patrons are served, given, or allowed to consume alcoholic beverages after legal closing hours from the supplies that the patrons have previously purchased or reserved; or
That sells, dispenses, serves, keeps, or allows to be consumed any setups or other component parts of mixed alcoholic drinks to its members or guests.

paragraph.text: A person, partnership, corporation, or any other organization may not maintain or operate a “bottle club”. However, any club or organization which qualifies for and is granted a Class C license as provided in this subsection may operate also as a “bottle club” under this license.

This subsection may not be construed to apply to any “bring your own bottle” social function at which alcoholic beverages are furnished only by the guests or participants. If such a social function is held in a facility available to the public, the function shall be conducted during the hours of operation permitted for a Class C license establishment.

A Class D beer, wine and liquor license shall be issued by the license issuing authority of the county in which the place of business is located. It authorizes the holder to keep for sale and sell all alcoholic beverages at retail at the place described in it, for consumption on the premises or elsewhere. A license may not be issued for any drugstore.
The annual license fee shall be paid to the local collecting agent before any license is issued, for distribution as provided.
In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners for the jurisdiction to which the subsection applies.

subsection.text: In Allegany County the annual license fee is $700.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Anne Arundel County.
There are two type Class D beer, wine and liquor licenses:

subparagraph.text: A limited Class D license which allows for on premises consumption only.
A Class D license which allows for consumption on premises or elsewhere.
The annual license fee for a limited Class D license is $1,080.
The annual license fee for a Class D on– and off–sale license is $1,200.

paragraph.text: The Board, upon the filing of an application for any new Class D beer, wine and liquor license, may limit the sale of alcoholic beverages to consumption only on the premises.
Subject to § 11–503(b)(2) of this article, in Baltimore City the annual license fee is $825.
In Baltimore City, the hours and days for sale for the license are as provided under § 11–503 of this article.
This subsection applies only in Baltimore County.
The annual license fee is $1,500.

The area of the licensed premises normally used for the preparation and consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises may occupy no less than 80 percent of the square foot area. These occupancy requirements do not apply to or affect any present licensee having this license prior to December 31, 1966.
This subsection applies only in Calvert County.
This license may be issued in the entire county.
The annual license fee is:

subparagraph.text: $1,250, if the place of business remains open until midnight; or
$2,250, if the place of business remains open until 2 a.m.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Caroline County.
The annual license fee is $1,250 for a 6-day license.
The annual license fee is $1,600 for a 7-day license.
All alcoholic beverages sold under this license must be consumed on the premises.
A licensee may sell beer, wine and liquor for consumption on the premises only.

subsection.text: This section does not apply in Carroll County.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Cecil County.
The annual license fee is $750.
This subsection applies only in Charles County.
The annual license fee:

subparagraph.text: For on- and off-sale of all alcoholic beverages is $1,140; and
For off-sale for liquor and on- or off-sale for beer and wine is $720.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Dorchester County.
The Board of License Commissioners may issue a Class D (on–sale) beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee is $1,500.
A license issued under this subsection is a 7–day license.
Alcoholic beverages sold under this subsection may be consumed only on the licensed premises.
An individual who is under the age of 21 years may not be on the licensed premises.
In accordance with § 9–201 of this article, only the Board of License Commissioners may decide the number of Class D licenses to be issued.
The Board of License Commissioners shall:

subparagraph.text: Determine whether the premises for which a Class D license is issued meets the requirements of § 9–210 of this article; and
Adopt regulations to carry out this subsection.

subsection.text: This section does not apply in Frederick County.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Garrett County.

subparagraph.text: There are two types of Class D licenses, neither of which may be issued to any grocery store having a primary business of selling food at retail to the general public for off-premises consumption.

sub-subparagraph.text: A Class D (on-sale) license for beer, wine and liquor sales shall be issued to establishments whose total beer, wine and liquor sales constitute at least 75 percent on-premises consumption and up to 25 percent off-premises consumption.

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: The annual license fee is $1,500.
The issuing fee for a new license is $1,500, in addition to the annual fee.

sub-subparagraph.text: A Class D (off-sale) license for beer, wine and liquor sales shall be issued to establishments whose total beer, wine and liquor sales constitute at least 75 percent off-premises consumption and up to 25 percent on-premises consumption.

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: The annual license fee is $3,000.
The issuing fee for a new license is $3,000, in addition to the annual fee.

subparagraph.text: Until July 1, 1995, a holder of an existing Class D alcoholic beverages license prior to July 1, 1987 may apply for a license under paragraph (2) of this subsection using the procedure that the Board establishes.

If the applicant is granted a license under paragraph (2) of this subsection, the applicant may be exempt from paying the issuing fee as provided under § 9-212(c) of this article. However, the applicant shall pay:

sub-subparagraph.text: The annual license fee for that license; or

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: An amount not less than the fee and the surcharge percent amount paid to the Board through December 31, 1986 under the former license, provided the total amount to be paid is not less than $1,250; or

If the applicant’s former license was granted after January 1, 1986, an annualized amount based on what was paid to the Board through December 31, 1986 under the applicant’s former license provided the total amount is not less than $1,250.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Harford County.
Subject to the provisions of this subsection, the Liquor Control Board may issue only to the current holder of any Class B license:

subparagraph.text: A 7-day (on-sale) Class D license for all alcoholic beverages, with an annual license fee of $3,000; or
A 7-day (on- and off-sale) Class D license for all alcoholic beverages, with an annual license fee of $4,000.

paragraph.text: The holder of a Class B license may apply for a Class D license authorized by this subsection.
The Liquor Control Board has sole authority, in accordance with §§ 9-201 and 10-203 of this article, to decide the number of Class D licenses authorized by this subsection to be issued.
Upon the issuance of a Class D license by the Liquor Control Board, the licensee to whom the Class D license is issued shall surrender to the Board the Class B license it held.
The Liquor Control Board shall ensure that any Class D license issued under the authority of this subsection meets the requirements of § 9-213 of this article.
In accordance with § 16-301(a) of this article, the Liquor Control Board shall adopt regulations to carry out this subsection.
This subsection applies only in Howard County.
The Board may issue the following types of licenses:

sub-subparagraph.text: A 7-day (on-sale) Class D beer, wine and liquor license for on-premises consumption only;
The annual license fee is $1,000;
A 6-day (on-sale) Class D beer, wine and liquor license for on-premises consumption only;
The annual license fee is $600;
A 7-day (on- and off-sale) Class D beer, wine and liquor license for on- and off-premises consumption;
The annual license fee is $1,000; or
A 6-day (on- and off-sale) Class D beer, wine and liquor license for on- and off-premises consumption;
The annual license fee is $800.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Kent County.
The Board may issue a Class D beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee is $1,500.
On Sunday, a licensee may sell only beer and light wine for off-premises consumption.
A person under the age of 21 years is not permitted in a tavern or on the licensed premises of an establishment which has a license issued pursuant to this section.

subparagraph.text: A person under 21 years of age may not knowingly make any misrepresentation or false statement as to the person’s age in order to gain entrance to an establishment licensed under this subsection.
A police officer or alcoholic beverages inspector shall issue a citation under § 10-119 of the Criminal Law Article to a person who violates the provisions of this paragraph.
Penalties for offenses of this paragraph are as set forth in § 10-119 of the Criminal Law Article.

subsection.text: This section does not apply in Montgomery County.
This section does not apply in Prince George’s County.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Queen Anne’s County.
A Class D beer, wine and liquor (on- and limited off-sale) license may be issued for on-premises consumption and the off-sale of beer only.
The annual license fee is $1,800.
This subsection applies only in St. Mary’s County.
The annual license fee:

subparagraph.text: For a Class D beer, wine and liquor license is $250; and
For a special Class D beer, wine and liquor license that entitles the holder to sell on Sunday is $650.

paragraph.text: In Somerset County the annual license fee is $1,265.
Spirituous liquors may be sold for on–sale consumption only, but beer and wine may be sold for both on– and off–sale consumption.
This section does not apply in Talbot County.
Section 18-101 of this article permits the Talbot County Council to provide for the retail alcoholic beverages laws for the county which, if enacted, supersede the provisions of this article.

subsection.text: In Washington County the annual license fee is $750.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Wicomico County.

subparagraph.text: There is a Class D beer, wine and liquor tavern license.
The annual license fee is $2,200.
Any license issued under this paragraph is for 7 days.
In order to qualify for a license under this paragraph, the premises that is the subject of the application shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: Have a minimum seating capacity of 140 persons, not including the bar area or dancing floor area; and
Meet the minimum requirements of the fire code applicable to the jurisdiction in which the premises is located.

subparagraph.text: Alcoholic beverages sold under this paragraph shall be consumed on the premises only.
A person may not be on the premises if the person is under the legal drinking age for the consumption of alcohol in the State.

All alcoholic beverages other than beer and light wine shall be purchased from the Liquor Control Board for Wicomico County and shall be charged not more than 15% above the wholesale cost to the dispensary.
There is a Class D beer, wine and liquor entertainment and amusement license.
The annual license fee is $4,000.
A license issued under this paragraph is a 7–day license for consumption on the premises only.
To qualify for a license, the premises that is the subject of the application shall be an entertainment amusement center that:

sub-subparagraph.text: Is a business establishment that accommodates the public;
Has a minimum seating capacity of 140 persons, not including the bar area or dancing floor area;
Meets the minimum requirements of the fire code applicable for the jurisdiction in which the premises is located;
Is fully equipped with a proper and adequate dining room with facilities for preparing and serving regular meals;

Excluding the kitchen, has more than 50% of its floor space dedicated to or occupied by equipment for foosball, billiards, darts, virtual reality simulation games, and other games that the Board approves that require the active physical participation of one or more players; and
Has an initial capital investment of at least $300,000, excluding the cost of the land and building.
For purposes of subparagraph (iv)5 of this paragraph, games approved by the Board may not include keno, card games, pinball machines, and bar games.

Any floor space occupied by a jukebox or similar passive entertainment device may not be counted in calculating whether the floor space requirements under subparagraph (iv)5 of this paragraph have been met.

subparagraph.text: Except for beer and light wine, the license holder shall purchase all of the alcoholic beverages that are sold for consumption on the premises from a county dispensary and may not be charged more than 15% above the wholesale cost to the dispensary.
An individual who is:

sub-subparagraph.text: Under the age of 21 years may not enter or remain on the licensed premises after 9 p.m.; and
Under the age of 17 years may not enter the licensed premises without a parent or guardian.

subparagraph.text: The Board may adopt regulations to carry out this paragraph.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Worcester County.

subparagraph.text: A Class D beer, wine and liquor license may be issued only within:

sub-subparagraph.text: The corporate limits of Ocean City;
The boundary lines of the 10th taxing district;
The area bounded by U.S. Route 50 to the south, Turville Creek and Herring Creek to the east, St. Martin River to the north, and Maryland Route 589 to the west;
The area bounded by Maryland Route 589 to the north and east, U.S. Route 50 to the south, and U.S. Route 113 to the west; and

From the intersection of Maryland Route 589 and U.S. Route 50, an area bounded by a line that extends 1,500 feet south of U.S. Route 50, east to the boundary of the 10th taxing district, north along the 10th taxing district boundary to U.S. Route 50, and west to the intersection of Maryland Route 589 and U.S. Route 50.

subparagraph.text: The annual license fee for the six–day license set by the Worcester County Commissioners may not be less than $3,000.
The annual license fee for the seven–day license set by the Worcester County Commissioners may not be less than $3,500.
Seven–day license holders may sell beer, wine and liquor (on–sale) and beer and light wine (off–sale).
All license fees shall go to the general funds of the county. However, if the licensed premises are in a municipal corporation, 75 percent of the fees shall go to that municipal corporation.

sub-subparagraph.text: Except as provided in subsubparagraph 2 of this subparagraph, all licensees shall purchase all wines and liquors, except light wine and beer, from the Worcester County Department of Liquor Control. They shall be charged not more than 85 percent of the retail price or any special sale price or discount price, whichever is lower, set by the Department for wines and liquors. All licensees may purchase beer and light wine from licensed wholesalers.
Beginning on May 1, 2016, a licensee may elect to purchase wine and liquor from a licensed wholesaler under § 15–204(e) of this article.

subparagraph.text: The hours for sale are as provided in § 11–524 of this article.

With respect to the Ocean City Convention Hall, only the Convention Hall Commission and its successors may be issued an alcoholic beverages license. The Commission may permit its vendors to dispense alcoholic beverages pursuant to whatever license the Commission is granted. Further, the Commission may contract to receive some proportion of the revenue derived from the vendor’s sale of alcoholic beverages. This license shall be subject to the following restrictions:

sub-subparagraph.text: This monopoly may not impinge upon the provisions of § 7–101(u)(5) of this article;
Only on–sale transactions shall be permitted; and
Consumption of alcoholic beverages shall be restricted to the premises.

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: The Board may issue a special 7–day Class D beer, wine and liquor on–sale retail license to the Mayor of Ocean City for use on the premises of the Ocean City municipal golf courses.
A separate license is required for each Ocean City municipal golf course.

sub-subparagraph.text: Prior to the issuance of any license under this paragraph, the Mayor shall designate an individual to complete training in an alcohol awareness program approved under § 13–101 of this article.
The individual designated by the Mayor shall:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: Represent the concessionaire; and
Be directly involved with the management of the sale of beer, wine, and liquor by the concessionaire.

subparagraph.text: The holder may contract with and permit a concessionaire to keep for sale and sell beer, wine, and liquor for on premises consumption only.
The hours and days of sale under the license are the same as a Class D beer, wine and liquor on–sale license under § 11–524 of this article or during lesser hours specified by the holder.
A license shall be issued and renewed without charge or an annual fee and may not be transferred.

subsection.text: There is a Class E beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee is $150, which shall be paid to the Office of the Comptroller before the license is issued.
The license shall be issued by the Office of the Comptroller, subject to the conditions and restrictions set forth in this section.

The license authorizes the owner or operator of any water vessel, ferry boat or other vessel, used for the transportation for hire of passengers, from ports in Maryland to other ports in Maryland or to coastal ports in other states or foreign ports, or boats licensed to operate tours within Maryland waterways to sell all alcoholic beverages for consumption thereon.
One license shall be issued for each water vessel, ferry boat, or other vessel on which such beverages are sold and shall be good throughout this State.
The holder of any license may not make any sale pursuant to the license while the licensed vessel is made fast to any wharf or pier in any county where such sales are prohibited by local law.
There is a Class F beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee is $200, which shall be paid to the Office of the Comptroller before the license is issued.

The license shall be issued by the Office of the Comptroller and authorizes the owner or operator of any steam, diesel, or electric railway or club, parlor, buffet, observation, sleeping or dining cars upon the lines of any steam, diesel, or electric railway in this State, to keep for sale and to sell all alcoholic beverages upon any of such cars for consumption upon such cars, and every such license shall be good throughout the State.
There is a Class G beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee is $200, which shall be paid to the Office of the Comptroller before the license is issued.

The license shall be issued by the Office of the Comptroller and authorizes the owner or operator of any airplanes or aircraft operated upon regularly scheduled flights over any part of this State to keep for sale and to sell all alcoholic beverages upon any of such airplanes or aircraft for consumption thereon and every such license shall be good throughout the State.
This subsection applies to any conference center facility:

paragraph.text: Jointly owned, operated, or financed by the Maryland Stadium Authority and a political subdivision or an instrumentality of that political subdivision that is physically connected to an adjacent hotel; and
That provides food and beverage service to registered guests at that hotel.

subsection.text: There is a special Class B license, known as Class B-BWL (H-C), that shall be available for issuance to a management company of the facility described in subsection (a) of this section by the board of license commissioners in the jurisdiction in which the facility is located. The license may authorize only on-sale privileges at the facility and the adjacent hotel, including service to registered guests in their rooms.
The annual license fee is $2,500.
The provisions of §§ 9-102 and 10-103(b)(12) and (15) of this article do not apply to this license.

In any jurisdiction that has a food-to-alcoholic beverage ratio requirement for a Class B (on-site) hotel and restaurant license, the laws and regulations pertaining to the ratio requirement in that jurisdiction apply to this license.
This section applies throughout the State.
The State Comptroller may issue a statewide caterer’s (SCAT) license to a person who:

paragraph.text: Is engaged in the business of catering;
Meets all State and local requirements, and holds all requisite licenses relating to the catering business conducted;
Holds any catering license that may be required under this article in the local political subdivision in which the person’s principal office is located;

subparagraph.text: Holds an existing permanent retail alcoholic beverages license, other than a Class C license; or
Does not hold an alcoholic beverages license but who has a permanent office and storage facility for alcoholic beverages in the State; and

paragraph.text: Meets all other requirements under this section.

subsection.text: The holder of a SCAT license may acquire alcoholic beverages:

paragraph.text: If the holder operates under a permanent retail alcoholic beverages license, through a licensed wholesaler; or
Except as provided in § 15-204 of this article, through a licensed retail dealer located in the State that has off-sale privileges.
The SCAT license may be issued as a general or limited license.
A general SCAT license shall authorize the holder to operate in any political subdivision of the State provided that the holder complies with all other provisions of this subtitle.
A limited SCAT license shall authorize the holder to operate in not more than three contiguous designated political subdivisions of the State provided that:

subparagraph.text: The holder complies with all other provisions of this subtitle; and
The total population of the designated political subdivisions does not exceed 1,000,000, based upon the most recent applicable population records of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (3) of this subsection, all privileges conferred under a SCAT license shall be applicable to a general or limited SCAT license.
The annual fees for a SCAT license are:

subparagraph.text: For a general SCAT license, $2,000;

For a limited SCAT license, the fee shall be based upon the most recent applicable population records of the designated political subdivisions, as compiled by the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, as follows:

sub-subparagraph.text: A population of not more than 300,000$750;
A population of more than 300,000, but less than 600,000$1,000; and
A population of at least 600,000$1,500.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph (1) of this subsection, an applicant for a SCAT license who holds a permanent retail license and a special catering license, or who pays an additional fee for the privilege of catering in the applicant’s political subdivision, shall be entitled to a license fee credit not to exceed the additional catering fee paid in the political subdivision, provided that there is a minimum license fee payment of $250 for a general or limited SCAT license.
The holder of a SCAT license:

subparagraph.text: May serve alcoholic beverages at a catered event throughout the State to individuals 21 years of age or older on an unlicensed premises or on a premises for which a temporary alcoholic beverages license has been issued by the local board of license commissioners; and
May store unused alcoholic beverages at the holder’s principal place of business for use at future catered events.

paragraph.text: A licensed retailer who operates solely in the political subdivision under authority of the local board of license commissioners need not acquire a SCAT license.

To enforce the prohibitions under § 12-108 of this article against selling or furnishing alcoholic beverages to persons who are under 21 years of age or visibly under the influence of an alcoholic beverage, the local board of license commissioners may conduct investigations at catered events.

If a local board of license commissioners determines that sales have been made unlawfully, the board shall report its findings to the State Comptroller, who shall take the action that the State Comptroller determines is appropriate.
A holder of a SCAT license:

subparagraph.text: Shall supply service personnel, including bartenders and waiters, at the events that the holder caters;
Shall ensure that the service personnel are present at all times during the events; and
May not deliver alcoholic beverages under the SCAT license to a catered event without service personnel on the premises.

paragraph.text: At the end of a catered event, all full containers of alcoholic beverages must be returned to the principal place of business of the holder of the SCAT license.

subsection.text: To ensure product integrity, a partial keg of malt beverage may not be used at another catered event.
At each catered event at which alcoholic beverages products are served:

paragraph.text: A holder of a SCAT license shall have at least one individual on-site who has been certified by an alcoholic awareness program that is licensed by the State Comptroller; and
The sale of food shall represent at least 70% of the total cost of the event.

subsection.text: Except when operating under a permanent on-premises retail alcoholic beverages license issued by a local licensing authority, a holder of a SCAT license may not serve alcoholic beverages at the holder’s principal office and may not serve alcoholic beverages at any event for which the holder is a sponsor or promoter.

The holder of a SCAT license may sell and serve alcoholic beverages only during the hours and days that the holder of a Class B license may operate in the jurisdiction where the catered event is conducted.
The State Comptroller may adopt regulations to establish reporting requirements and to carry out this section.
This section applies only in Baltimore City.

In this section, “caterer” means any beer and wine or beer, wine and liquor licensee who contracts to provide food and alcoholic beverages to sponsors of public or private events held off the licensed premises.
The Board of License Commissioners may add a special off-sale caterer privilege for the sole purpose of authorizing a licensee to be a caterer.
A licensee who holds the special off-sale caterer privilege may contract to provide food and alcoholic beverages for consumption at a catered event.
The licensee may exercise the special off-sale caterer privilege only during the hours and days that are permitted under this article for the existing beer and wine or beer, wine and liquor license.

paragraph.text: A licensee who holds a special off-sale caterer privilege shall have the facilities to prepare and deliver food to the site of the catered event.
The Baltimore City Health Department shall approve the food preparation facilities and issue a caterer’s license before the Board adds or renews a special off-sale caterer privilege.

subsection.text: A special off-sale caterer privilege is not a separate class of license and, if it is granted, the privilege is incorporated within the existing on-sale beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual fee for the special off-sale caterer privilege is $500 in addition to the annual fee for the existing beer and wine or beer, wine and liquor license.
A special off-sale caterer privilege may be renewed.
This section applies only in Baltimore County.

In this section “caterer” means a Class B or Class D on-sale beer, wine and liquor licensee who contracts to provide food and sell alcoholic beverages to sponsors of public or private events held off the premises.
The Board of License Commissioners may add a special privilege for off-premises consumption for the sole purpose of authorizing the licensee to be a caterer.
A holder of the special off-sale privilege shall contract and provide food as well as alcoholic beverages for consumption at all off-sale catered events.

The holder may exercise the off-sale consumption privilege only during the hours and days that are permitted in this article for a Class B or Class D on-sale beer, wine and liquor license in the county.
This license privilege is not a separate class of license and, if it is granted, the privilege is incorporated within the existing Class B or Class D on-sale beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee for the special off-sale license privilege is $500 in addition to the annual fee for the Class B or Class D on-sale beer, wine and liquor license.
The special off-sale privilege may be renewed.
This section applies only in Caroline County.

paragraph.text: The Caroline County Board of License Commissioners may issue a caterer’s license to a licensee who:

subparagraph.text: Holds any alcoholic beverages license issued in the county;
Holds a caterer’s license issued by the county health department; and
Contracts to provide food and alcoholic beverages to sponsors of public or private events.

paragraph.text: The Caroline County Board of License Commissioners shall set the license fee for a caterer’s license.

subsection.text: A caterer’s license issued under this section authorizes the holder to keep for sale and sell or provide alcoholic beverages on the premises of and during the catered event.
A holder shall provide food as well as alcoholic beverages for consumption at the catered event.

A holder may exercise the privileges of a caterer’s license only during the hours and days that are authorized for a Class B restaurant or hotel (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor licensee in Caroline County.
This section does not require a Class B restaurant or hotel (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor licensee to have a caterer’s license for catering on the premises that is covered by the existing license.
This section only applies in Carroll County.

paragraph.text: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
“Board” means the Carroll County Board of License Commissioners.

“Caterer” means an establishment containing one or more banquet rooms suitable for public gatherings, with food preparation facilities on the premises, which contracts to provide food and alcoholic beverages to sponsors of public or private events.

A Class H beer, wine and liquor license shall be issued by the Board which authorizes the owner or operator of a catering establishment to keep for sale and sell all alcoholic beverages at retail at the premises described in the license for consumption on the premises.
The annual license fee is the amount set for a Class B beer, wine and liquor license in § 6-201 of this article.
The fee shall be paid to the Board before any license is issued. The fee shall be distributed as provided in this article.

subsection.text: A caterer licensed under this section also may contract with patrons to permit them to bring personal alcoholic beverages onto the premises of the caterer for consumption at catered events.

A hotel or restaurant which holds a Class B beer, wine and liquor license need not obtain a Class H license if catering is, or has been, a part of the service provided by the hotel or restaurant. Any caterer holding a Class B beer, wine and liquor license shall automatically be issued a Class H liquor license, without any additional charge to the caterer for the license so issued, and the Class B license held by the caterer shall be surrendered upon receipt of the Class H license.

paragraph.text: There is a Class HC license.
The Board may issue a Class HC caterer’s (on- and limited off-sale) beer, wine and liquor license to an applicant who holds a Class H caterer’s beer, wine and liquor license.
A Class HC caterer’s licensee may sell:

subparagraph.text: Beer, wine, and liquor, 7 days a week, on the premises for on-premises consumption; and
Beer, wine, and liquor, 7 days a week, at catered events held off the premises for consumption on-premises at the event.

paragraph.text: A Class HC licensee shall provide food in addition to alcoholic beverages for consumption at the catered event.
The annual license fee is $250 more than the annual fee for a Class B hotel or restaurant (on- and off-sale) beer, wine and liquor license.
The hours and days for sale for a Class HC licensee are the same as for a Class B hotel and restaurant (on- and off-sale) beer, wine and liquor licensee.

A Class HC licensee may hold only eight events in any calendar year that are self-sponsored. Pursuant to regulations adopted by the Board, these events may be held only at a location approved by the Board and on dates approved by the Board.

subsection.text: This section applies only in Frederick County.
The Board of License Commissioners may issue a caterer’s license to a holder of a Class B restaurant or hotel (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee is $1,500.

A caterer’s license issued under this section authorizes the holder to provide alcoholic beverages at publicly or privately sponsored events that are held off the premises that is covered by the Class B restaurant or hotel (on-sale) license.

paragraph.text: The holder of a caterer’s license shall prepare, deliver, and provide food as well as provide alcoholic beverages for consumption at the catered event.
The county health department shall approve the facilities that prepare the food before the license may be issued, reissued, or renewed.
The holder of a caterer’s license shall provide all service employees to serve the alcoholic beverages at the catered event.
At least one employee shall have been certified by an alcohol awareness program and shall be on the premises at all times during the catered event.

subsection.text: After the event, all alcoholic beverages shall remain in possession of the holder of the caterer’s license and be returned to the premises covered by the Class B restaurant or hotel license.

The holder of a caterer’s license may exercise the privileges under the license only during the hours and days that are permitted in this article for a Class B restaurant or hotel (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license.
This section does not require a holder of an existing Class B (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor license to hold a caterer’s license for catering on the premises that is covered by the existing license.
In this section, “holder” means a holder of a caterer’s (CAT) license issued by the Board of License Commissioners of Garrett County.
This section applies only in Garrett County.
The Board of License Commissioners of Garrett County may issue a caterer’s (CAT) license to a person who meets the requirements of this section.

paragraph.text: A CAT license authorizes the holder to keep for sale and sell or provide off-sale alcoholic beverages during a catered event.
A holder may not:

subparagraph.text: Hold a self-sponsored catered event; or
Provide only alcoholic beverages at a catered event.

paragraph.text: Before a CAT license is issued or renewed, an applicant or holder:

subparagraph.text: Shall have facilities to prepare food and deliver food to the site of catered events and obtain approval of the facilities from the Garrett County Department of Health; and
May not hold any other license issued by the Board of License Commissioners.

paragraph.text: A holder need not have a banquet hall.
The annual CAT license fee is $500.
The issuing fee that is charged for each new CAT license is $500.

subsection.text: A holder may exercise the privileges of a caterer’s license only during the hours and days that are authorized for a Class B beer, wine and liquor license in Garrett County.

paragraph.text: A holder shall:

subparagraph.text: Purchase all alcoholic beverages from a wholesaler or retailer licensed to sell alcoholic beverages in Garrett County; and
Contract for and provide food as well as alcoholic beverages for consumption at the catered event.

paragraph.text: During a catered event, a holder shall have at least one individual on site who has been certified by an alcohol awareness program licensed by the State Comptroller.
At the end of a catered event, a holder shall return all containers of alcoholic beverages that are not empty to the holder’s principal place of business.
This section applies only in Harford County.
The annual license fee is $1,500, which shall be paid to the Board before the license is issued and which shall be distributed as provided.
