A wine tasting or beer/wine tasting licensee may not serve more than 1 ounce from each given brand of wine to any one person.
A beer tasting or beer/wine tasting licensee may not serve more than 3 ounces from each brand of beer to any one person.
The annual fee of a beer tasting or wine tasting license:

sub-subparagraph.text: For holders of a BWL license, is $120 in addition to the cost of the BWL license;
For holders of a BW license, is $120 in addition to the cost of the BW license; and
For holders of a B license, is $110 in addition to the cost of the B license.

subparagraph.text: The Board of License Commissioners shall set the annual fee for a beer/wine tasting license.

paragraph.text: In Prince George’s County, the Board of License Commissioners may issue a beer, wine, and liquor tasting (BWLT) license.
A beer, wine, and liquor tasting license may be issued only to holders of a beer, wine and liquor license.

A beer, wine, and liquor tasting license authorizes the consumption of one–half an ounce of liquor from a given brand and 1.5 ounces from all brands by any one person in a single day for tasting and sampling purposes only.
The limitations on the consumption of beer and wine under subsection (a)(4) of this section apply to a beer, wine, and liquor tasting license.
The Board shall set the annual fee for a beer, wine, and liquor tasting license.

subsection.text: The Prince George’s County Board of License Commissioners may adopt rules or regulations providing additional requirements to implement this section.
This section applies to Queen Anne’s County.

paragraph.text: The Board of License Commissioners may issue a wine tasting (WT) alcoholic beverages license.
A WT license authorizes, for tasting or sampling only, the on-premises consumption of wine that contains not more than 22% of alcohol by volume.
Notwithstanding any other law, the license may be issued to a holder of a Class A beer, wine and liquor license or a Class A beer and wine license.
The licensee may serve:

subparagraph.text: Not more than 2 ounces from each given brand to any one person; and
Not more than 4 ounces to any one person in a single day.

paragraph.text: The annual license fee for a WT license is $100 in addition to the fee for any other alcoholic beverages license.

subsection.text: The Board of License Commissioners may adopt regulations to carry out this section.
This section applies only in Somerset County.

paragraph.text: The Board of License Commissioners may issue a wine tasting (WT) license for wine tasting and sampling.
A WT license may be issued only to a holder of a Class A beer and wine (off-sale) license.

subsection.text: The annual WT license fee is $150.

paragraph.text: An application for a WT license shall be made on a form that the Board of License Commissioners provides.
A renewal of the WT license may be made at the time the Class A beer and wine (off-sale) license is renewed.
The Board of License Commissioners may grant a WT license without a hearing.
If application for a WT license is denied, the applicant may request a public hearing before the Board of License Commissioners.
A WT license holder may not serve to any person for sampling or tasting purposes more than 1 ounce from each brand.
A maximum of six bottles may be opened at any one time at a wine sampling or tasting event.
The total number of days during which wine sampling or tasting events are held may not exceed 15 in any period for which a WT license is in effect.
A WT license holder shall notify the Board of License Commissioners in writing at least 5 days before a wine sampling or tasting event.
Once opened, each bottle used for a wine sampling or tasting event shall be marked that it is to be used for that purpose only.
The contents of each bottle may not be mixed with any other bottle, and all bottles shall be destroyed once they are empty.
A WT license is for on-premises consumption only.
Wine sampling or tasting may not be conducted from a drive-through window.

subsection.text: This section applies only in St. Mary’s County.
The Board of License Commissioners may issue a 1-day Class BWTS beer and wine (on-premises) tasting or sampling license.

A Class BWTS license may be issued only to a holder of a current alcoholic beverages license or an organization that qualifies for a special Class C beer, special Class C beer and wine license, or a special Class C beer, wine and liquor license under § 7-101(r) of this article.
The license fee is $50.
A Class BWTS license authorizes the holder to allow the consumption of wine or beer for tasting or sampling, if the alcoholic beverages are given to consumers at no charge.
A person may consume wine or beer covered by a Class BWTS license in a quantity not exceeding:

paragraph.text: 1 ounce from a single brand of wine, and 4 ounces from all brands in a single day; and
3 ounces from a single brand of beer, and 8 ounces from all brands in a single day.

subsection.text: All consumption of alcoholic beverages shall occur on the licensed premises of the holder of the Class BWTS license.
The Board of License Commissioners need not publish an application for a Class BWTS license before granting the license.
A Class BWTS license may not be granted to a person more than 12 times in a calendar year.
At the end of the day for which a Class BWTS license is valid, the license holder shall dispose of unconsumed alcoholic beverages remaining in a container opened for tasting or sampling.
This section applies only in Washington County.
A special wine tasting license (WTL) may be issued only to a holder of a Class A (off-sale) beer, wine and liquor license or a Class B (on-off sale) beer, wine and liquor license.
The annual license fee is $200, in addition to the annual license fee of a Class A (off-sale) beer, wine and liquor license.
The Board of License Commissioners may issue a special wine tasting license (WTL) to permit on-premises consumption of wine for tasting or sampling purposes only.
The holder of a special wine tasting license may not charge for the wine tasting or sampling.
The license is effective for use no more than 12 days in a licensing year. The licensee shall notify the Board in writing at least 10 days in advance of any scheduled tasting date.
Servings are limited to no more than 2 ounces of any one wine to any one customer.
The Board may adopt regulations to implement the provisions of this section.
In this section, “license” means a beer tasting (BT) license, a wine tasting (WT) license, or a beer/wine tasting (BWT) license.
This section applies only in Wicomico County.

paragraph.text: The Board of License Commissioners may issue a:

subparagraph.text: Beer tasting (BT) license for beer tasting and sampling;
Wine tasting (WT) license for wine tasting and sampling; and
Beer/wine tasting (BWT) license for beer or wine tasting and sampling.

paragraph.text: A license may be issued only to a holder of a Class A beer and wine (off–sale) license or a Class A beer, wine and liquor (off–sale) license.

subsection.text: The annual fee is:

paragraph.text: For a BT license, $150;
For a WT license, $150; and
For a BWT license, $250.
An application for a license shall be made on a form that the Board of License Commissioners provides.
A renewal of the license may be made at the time the Class A beer and wine (off–sale) license or the Class A beer, wine and liquor (off–sale) license is renewed.
The Board of License Commissioners may grant a license without a hearing.
If application for a license is denied, the applicant may request a public hearing before the Board of License Commissioners.
An individual may be served, for sampling or tasting purposes, not more than:

subparagraph.text: 1 ounce of wine from each brand; or
3 ounces of beer from each brand.

paragraph.text: A maximum of:

subparagraph.text: Six bottles of wine may be open at any one time at a wine or beer and wine sampling or tasting event; or
Six containers of beer may be open at any one time at a beer or beer and wine sampling or tasting event.

paragraph.text: The total number of days during which beer, wine, or beer and wine sampling or tasting events are held may not exceed 20 in any period for which a license is in effect.
A license holder shall notify the Board of License Commissioners in writing at least 5 days before a beer, wine, or beer and wine sampling or tasting event.
Once opened, each bottle or container used for a beer, wine, or beer and wine sampling or tasting event shall be marked that it is to be used for that purpose only.
The contents of each bottle or container may not be mixed with any other bottle or container, and all bottles and containers shall be destroyed once they are empty.
A license is for on–premises consumption only.
Beer, wine, or beer and wine sampling or tasting may not be conducted from a drive–through window.

subsection.text: The Board of License Commissioners may adopt regulations to carry out this section.
This section applies only in Carroll County.
There is a Class C (golf course) beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) license.
The license may be issued for the use of a golf course or organization that:

paragraph.text: Is open to the public;
Is operated for profit;
Owns real estate in the county; and
Has a golf course with a minimum of 9 holes.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $1,500.
Subject to the approval of the Board of License Commissioners, the licensee may sell beer, wine and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the buildings which are part of the golf course.
A patron need not be seated to be served.
The hours and days of sale are as specified in § 11-507 of this article.
This section applies only in Cecil County.
There is a Class GC (golf course) beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) license.
The Board of License Commissioners may issue a Class GC license for use by an organization or country club that:

paragraph.text: Is public or private;
Is operated for profit;
Owns real estate in the county; and
Has a regular or championship golf course with a minimum of 18 holes.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $2,000.
A Class GC license authorizes the licensee to sell beer, wine, and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the buildings, including the clubhouse, that are used for golfing purposes.
A patron need not be seated to be served.
A prohibition on the distance that licensed premises must be from a structure used as a hospital, house of worship, or school does not apply to a Class GC licensee.
The hours and days of sale are as specified for a Class C licensee under § 11-508 of this article.
This section applies only in Charles County.
A licensee may sell and a person may consume alcoholic beverages allowed under the license on the grounds of any publicly or privately owned golf course.
This section applies only in Harford County.
There is a Class GC (golf course) beer, wine and liquor license.
The licensee shall own or operate a golf course that:

paragraph.text: Is open to the public;
Is operated for profit; and
Has a minimum of 18 holes.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $3,500.
The licensee may sell beer, wine and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the buildings, including the clubhouse, used for golfing purposes.
A patron need not be seated to be served.
The hours and days for sale are as specified in § 11-513(b)(1) of this article.
The prohibition on the distance a licensee must remain from a church or school specified in § 9-213 of this article does not apply to Class GC (golf course) licensees.
This section applies only in Howard County.
In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners.
The Board may issue a 7-day Class GC (golf course) beer and light wine license or a 7-day Class GC (golf course) beer, wine and liquor license.
A license may be issued on behalf of an organization that owns or manages a golf course with a minimum of 18 holes.
The annual license fee is:

paragraph.text: $350 for a 7-day Class GC (golf course) beer and light wine license; and
$1,500 for a 7-day Class GC (golf course) beer, wine and liquor license.

subsection.text: The license is for the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises.
The hours and days for sale are found in § 11-514 of this article. However, the Board may reduce the hours and days for sale for all or a portion of the licensed premises.
The Board may place conditions on the location of sales and consumption, including:

paragraph.text: Prohibiting the sale and consumption of liquor on specified areas of premises with a Class GC (golf course) beer, wine and liquor license; and
Permitting the sale and consumption of only beer and light wine on specified areas of premises with a Class GC (golf course) beer, wine and liquor license.

subsection.text: The Board may restrict the sale of alcoholic beverages to beer and light wine on premises with a Class GC (golf course) beer, wine and liquor license if the Board determines that circumstances warrant.

paragraph.text: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
“Board” means the Prince George’s County Board of License Commissioners.
“Commission” means the Maryland-National Capital Park and Planning Commission.
The Board may issue special 7–day Class B–GC (golf course) on–sale beer and wine licenses for the exclusive use on the premises of the Commission’s golf courses located within Prince George’s County.
The special 7–day Class B–GC on–sale beer and wine license authorizes the holder to sell beer and wine from 1 or more outlets for consumption on the premises of the golf course.

subparagraph.text: A separate license is required for each applicable golf course.

A special 7–day Class B–GC on–sale beer and wine license shall be issued to each of the managers of the Commission’s golf courses upon making application and qualifying as a license holder under this article.
Except as provided in this subsection, the hours of sale for beer and wine under this license are from 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily, Monday through Sunday.
The Commission may:

sub-subparagraph.text: Reduce the hours of sale of beer and wine under this license; and
Discontinue the sale of beer and wine under this license from Labor Day through Memorial Day.

paragraph.text: The annual fee for a special 7–day Class B–GC on–sale beer and wine license is $365.

subsection.text: This section applies only in Washington County.
In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners.

paragraph.text: The Board may issue a 6-day Class C (golf course) beer and wine (on-sale) license and a 6-day Class C (golf course) beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) license.
The Board may issue a Sunday Class C (golf course) beer and wine (on-sale) license and a Sunday Class C (golf course) beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) license.

subsection.text: A license may be issued to a public golf course or organization that has a regular or championship golf course with a minimum of nine holes.
The annual license fee is:

paragraph.text: $750 for a 6-day Class C (golf course) beer and wine (on-sale) license;
$1,000 for a 6-day Class C (golf course) beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) license;
$250 for a Sunday Class C (golf course) beer and wine (on-sale) license; and
$250 for a Sunday Class C (golf course) beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) license.

subsection.text: Subject to the approval of the Board of License Commissioners, a licensee under this section may sell alcoholic beverages for consumption only on the land and in the buildings, including the clubhouse, used for golfing purposes.
A patron need not be seated to be served alcoholic beverages.

paragraph.text: The hours and days of sale are as specified in § 11-522 of this article.
The Board may reduce a licensee’s hours of sale of alcoholic beverages for all or a portion of the licensed premises.

subsection.text: This section applies only in Wicomico County.
There is a Class B beer, wine and liquor (golf course) license.
The license may be issued to a golf course or organization that:

paragraph.text: Is open to the public;
Is operated for profit;
Owns real estate in the county; and
Has a golf course with a minimum of 18 holes.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $2,200.
The licensee may sell beer, wine, and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the buildings, including the clubhouse, used for golfing purposes.
A patron need not be seated to be served.

All alcoholic beverages, other than beer and light wine, sold or offered for sale shall be purchased from the Liquor Control Board, and each bottle shall be stamped or otherwise designated “on-sale only” by the Board.
The hours and days for sale are as specified in § 11-523 of this article.

paragraph.text: This license may be issued only for a golf course that has the average daily receipts from the sale of food for each month exceed the average daily receipts from the sale of alcoholic beverages.
In calculating average daily receipts from the sale of food, an allocation of foodstuff contained in a mixed drink may not be included in average daily receipts from the sale of food.

subsection.text: This section applies only in Worcester County.
There is a Class C (golf course) beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) license.
The license may be issued for the use of a golf course or organization that:

paragraph.text: Is open to the public;
Is operated for profit;
Owns real estate in the county; and
Has a golf course with a minimum of 18 holes.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $2,625.
Subject to the approval of the Board of License Commissioners, the licensee may sell beer, wine and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the buildings that are part of the golf course.
A patron need not be seated to be served.
The hours and days of sale are as specified in § 11-524 of this article.
This section applies only in Caroline County.
There is a Class GC 7-day (golf course) beer, wine and liquor license.
The license may be issued to a golf course or organization that:

paragraph.text: Is open to the public;
Is operated for profit;
Owns real estate in the county; and
Has a golf course with a minimum of 18 holes.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $1,600.
The licensee may sell beer, wine, and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the buildings, including the clubhouse, used for golfing purposes.
A patron need not be seated to be served.
The hours and days for sale for a Class GC 7–day (golf course) beer, wine and liquor license are from 6 a.m. to 2 a.m. the following day, on Monday through Sunday.
This section applies only to a golf course that is:

paragraph.text: Located on land that is owned by Baltimore City; and
Operated by a Baltimore City golf course manager or a golf course manager under a management agreement with Baltimore City.
The Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City may issue a special Class M-G beer, wine and liquor license for use at a municipal golf course.
The Class M-G license may be issued to a golf course manager.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $600.
A Class M-G license may be used to sell beer, wine, and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the facilities used for golfing purposes.

paragraph.text: The licensee may designate an agent to sell beer, wine, and liquor at the golf course.
The agent shall be considered the vendor for collecting and remitting the sales and use tax.

subsection.text: On request of Baltimore City and subject to § 10-503(d) of this article, the Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City may transfer a Class M-G license to a different golf course manager.
The Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City shall adopt regulations to carry out this section.
This section applies only to a golf course that is:

paragraph.text: Located on land that is owned by St. Mary’s County; and
Operated by a St. Mary’s County golf course manager or a golf course manager under a management agreement with St. Mary’s County.
The St. Mary’s County Alcohol Beverage Board may issue a special Class M–G beer, wine and liquor license for use at a municipal golf course.
The Class M–G license may be issued to a golf course manager.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $600.
A Class M–G license may be used to sell beer, wine, and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the facilities used for golfing purposes.

paragraph.text: The licensee may designate an agent to sell beer, wine, and liquor at the golf course.
The agent shall be considered the vendor for collecting and remitting the sales and use tax.

subsection.text: On request of St. Mary’s County, the St. Mary’s County Alcohol Beverage Board may transfer a Class M–G license to a different golf course manager.
The St. Mary’s County Alcohol Beverage Board shall adopt regulations to carry out this section.

In Baltimore County the owner or owners of any regular licensed racing establishment, or the concessionaire or catering organization at such place, whether an individual, association or corporation, shall without additional residential, voting or locative qualifications be entitled to procure a license for the sale of beer and light wine within the confines of its racing park in said county, at a cost for such license of $25.00 per day; and shall be entitled to procure a license for the sale of beer, wine and liquor within the confines of its racing park in said county, at a cost for such license of $50.00 per day, and shall entitle the holder to sell at one or more locations within its said park. Such licenses and the licensees thereunder shall be subject to all laws, rules and regulations applicable in Baltimore County to the sale of alcoholic beverages, not inconsistent with the provisions of this section.
The provisions of this section are not restricted by the provisions in subsection (b) of § 12-107 of this article.

In Howard County the owner or owners of any regularly licensed racing establishment, whether individual, association of individuals, or a corporation, shall be entitled to procure a license for the sale of any and all alcoholic beverages within the confines of its racing park in the county.

The cost for such license shall be $1,000.00 each calendar year, payable to the Howard County Director of Finance. The license shall entitle the holder to sell at one or more locations within its said park.

Such licenses and the licensees thereunder shall be subject to all laws, rules and regulations applicable in Howard County to the sale of alcoholic beverages, not inconsistent with the provisions of this section.

In Worcester County the owner or owners of any regular licensed horse racing establishment, holding public meetings at which pari-mutuel betting is permitted, or the concessionaire or catering organization at that place, whether an individual, association or corporation, may procure without additional residential, voting or locative qualifications, a license for the sale of beer or beer and light wine within the confines of its racing park in the county, at the same cost for other beer and beer and light wine licenses in the county.

The person may procure a license for the sale of beer, wine and liquor within the confines of its racing park in the county, for a fee of $1,500 each year, which entitles the holder to sell at one or more locations within its park.
The licenses and the licensees are subject to all laws and regulations applicable in Worcester County to the sale of alcoholic beverages not inconsistent with the provisions of this section.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, all licensees shall purchase all liquors and wines, except light wine, from the Worcester County Department of Liquor Control. The licensee shall receive at least a 15 percent discount from the retail sales price or any special sale price or discount price, whichever is lower. All licensees may purchase beer and light wine from licensed wholesalers.
Beginning on May 1, 2016, a licensee may elect to purchase wine and liquor from a licensed wholesaler under § 15–204(e) of this article.

subsection.text: In this section, “drafthouse” means a theatre where motion pictures are shown to the public and where the patrons can purchase food, beer, wine and liquor on the premises while watching the motion picture.
This section only applies in Frederick County.
There is a Class B-DH (drafthouse) license.

paragraph.text: A Class B-DH (drafthouse) license shall be issued by the office where Class B licenses are issued in the county in which the drafthouse is located.
The license authorizes the holder to keep for sale and sell beer, wine and liquor at retail in any drafthouse described in the license for consumption on the premises only.
The annual license fee is $1,500.
The annual license fee shall be paid before any license is issued and the fee shall be distributed as provided in this article.

subsection.text: Applicants for this license shall:

paragraph.text: Have a minimum auditorium size of 3,500 square feet;
Have a minimum investment in tangible property, including kitchen equipment, furniture, and interior improvements, of at least $150,000;
Present a family matinee every Saturday and holiday that the theatre is open for business;
Submit to the Board of License Commissioners for its prior written approval the menu the drafthouse intends to offer, which shall include both hot and cold food;
Provide beer, wine and liquor at tables and seats in the drafthouse, but may not have a bar except for a service bar; and

Except when showing a family matinee, make beer, wine and liquor available for purchase only prior to and during the motion picture show, but all service shall cease at the end of the program. When showing a family matinee, alcoholic beverages may not be made available.

subsection.text: The hours and days for sale are as provided in § 11-511 of this article.
The licensee may charge an admission fee.
All motion pictures shown at the drafthouse shall comply with the provisions of § 10-405 of this article.

In this section, “drafthouse” means a theatre where motion pictures are shown to the public and where the patrons can purchase food, beer, and wine to consume on the premises while watching the motion picture.
This section applies only in the City of Greenbelt, Prince George’s County.
There is a Class B-DH (drafthouse) license.

paragraph.text: A Class B-DH (drafthouse) license shall be issued by the office where Class B licenses are issued in the county in which the drafthouse is located.
The license authorizes the holder to keep for sale and sell beer and wine at retail in any drafthouse described in the license for consumption on the premises only.
The annual license fee is $245.
The annual license fee shall be paid before any license is issued and the fee shall be distributed as provided in this article.

subsection.text: Applicants for this license shall:

paragraph.text: Have a minimum auditorium size of 3,500 square feet;
Have a minimum investment in tangible property, including kitchen equipment, furniture, and interior improvements, of at least $150,000;
Present a family matinee every Saturday and holiday that the theatre is open for business;
Submit to the Board of License Commissioners for its prior written approval the menu the drafthouse intends to offer, which shall include both hot and cold food;
Provide beer and wine at tables and seats in the drafthouse, but may not have a bar except for a service bar; and
Except when showing a family matinee, make beer and wine available for purchase only prior to and during the motion picture show, but all service shall cease at the end of the program.

subsection.text: The hours and days for sale are as provided in § 11-517(k) of this article.
The Board of License Commissioners shall determine the number of Class B-DH (drafthouse) licenses to be issued.
In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners of Baltimore City.
This section applies only in Baltimore City.
The Board may issue a special festival license for participation in a beer festival to be held on Class B retail licensed premises or on nonlicensed premises located in Baltimore City.

Notwithstanding any other provisions of this article, an applicant for a special festival license shall be the holder of an existing Class 5 brewery, Class 6 pub-brewery, or Class 7 micro-brewery manufacturer’s license issued under this article. Each manufacturer in the beer festival shall obtain a license.
A special festival licensee shall display and sell beer at retail for consumption on the licensed premises on the hours and days designated for the festival.
The products displayed and sold by a special festival licensee shall be:

paragraph.text: Products owned and produced by the licensee and provided by the licensee;
Products not owned and produced by the licensee and provided by the retail licensee if the event is held on a Class B licensed premises; or
Products not owned and produced by the licensee and directly obtained from wholesalers authorized to distribute their products in Baltimore City if the festival is held on a nonlicensed premises.

subsection.text: This section does not prohibit the holder of a special festival license from holding another alcoholic beverage license of a different class or nature.
The license fee is $50 per day.
The Board may designate no more than two times during a calendar year for a beer festival for which special festival licenses may be issued.
Each special festival license may be in effect for a period not to exceed 3 days.
The Board may adopt regulations to implement this section.
The Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners may issue a special beer festival license.

Notwithstanding any other provision to the contrary, an applicant for a special beer festival license shall be a holder of an existing retail alcoholic beverages license issued in the State, Class 5 brewery license, or Class 7 micro-brewery license, issued in accordance with this article.

A special beer festival license entitles the holder to display and sell at retail beer for consumption on or off the licensed premises on the days and for the hours designated for the special beer festival in Baltimore County.
The license fee is $50.
The provisions of this section may not prohibit the licensee from holding another alcoholic beverages license of a different class or nature.
The Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners:

paragraph.text: Except for the dates chosen for the Cumberland and Shenandoah Valley Wine Festival in Washington County, the Maryland Wine Festival in Carroll County, and the Anne Arundel County Beer and Wine Festival, shall approve one weekend annually for the special beer festival;
Shall approve a location in Baltimore County for the special beer festival which does not hold an alcoholic beverages license; and
Shall ensure that the primary focus of the special beer festival is the promotion of Maryland beer.

subsection.text: The Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners shall adopt regulations for implementing this section.
In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County.
The Board may issue a special beer festival license.

A special beer festival license entitles the holder to display and sell at retail beer for consumption on or off the licensed premises on the days and for the hours designated for the special beer festival in Frederick County.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this article, an applicant for a special beer festival license shall be the holder of a current retail alcoholic beverages license issued in the State, a Class 5 brewery license, or a Class 7 micro-brewery license.
The license fee is $15.
The Board shall:

paragraph.text: Approve four weekends annually for the special beer festival that does not fall on the dates chosen for the Cumberland and Shenandoah Valley Wine Festival in Washington County or the Maryland Wine Festival in Carroll County;
Approve for the special beer festival:

subparagraph.text: A nonlicensed premises in Frederick County; or
Subject to subsection (g) of this section, the premises in Frederick County of a holder of a stadium on-sale license; and

paragraph.text: Ensure that the primary focus of the special beer festival is the promotion of Maryland beer.

subsection.text: If a special beer festival is held on the premises in Frederick County of a holder of a stadium on-sale license, the holder may not sell any alcoholic beverages during the festival.
This section does not prohibit the licensee from holding another alcoholic beverages license of a different class or nature.
The Board shall adopt regulations to carry out this section.
In this section, “Board” means the Wicomico County Board of License Commissioners.
This section applies only in Wicomico County.

paragraph.text: The Board may issue a special beer festival license.
A special beer festival license may be used only at a beer festival held on nonlicensed premises located in Wicomico County.

Notwithstanding any other provision in this article, an applicant for a special beer festival license shall be the holder of an existing Class 5 brewery, Class 6 pub-brewery, or Class 7 micro-brewery manufacturer’s license issued under this article.
Each manufacturer that participates in the beer festival shall obtain a special beer festival license.

subsection.text: A special beer festival licensee may display and sell beer at retail for consumption on the licensed festival premises only on the hours and days designated for the festival.
The products displayed and sold by a special beer festival licensee shall be products owned and manufactured by the licensee.
This section does not prohibit a special beer festival licensee from holding another alcoholic beverages license of a different class or nature.
The license fee is $50 per day.
Each special beer festival license may be in effect for a period not exceeding 3 days.
The Board may:

paragraph.text: Adopt regulations to implement this section; and
Designate the number of times during a calendar year that a special beer festival license may be issued.

subsection.text: In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners for Carroll County.
The Board may issue a special beer festival license.

A special beer festival license entitles the holder to display and sell at retail beer for consumption on or off the licensed premises on the days and for the hours designated for the special beer festival in Carroll County.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this article, an applicant for a special beer festival license shall be the holder of a current retail alcoholic beverages license issued in the State, a Class 5 brewery license, or a Class 7 micro-brewery license.
The license fee is $50 for a one–day or two–day festival.
The Board shall:

paragraph.text: Approve one weekend for the special beer festival that does not fall on the dates chosen for the Cumberland and Shenandoah Valley Wine Festival in Washington County, or the Maryland Wine Festival in Carroll County, or the Anne Arundel Beer and Wine Festival;
Approve a nonlicensed premises in Carroll County for the special beer festival; and
Ensure that the primary focus of the special beer festival is the promotion of Maryland beer.

subsection.text: This section does not prohibit the licensee from holding another alcoholic beverages license of a different class or nature.
The Board shall adopt regulations to carry out this section.
The Alcoholic Beverage Board of St. Mary’s County may issue a special beer festival (BF) license.

Notwithstanding any other law, an applicant for a special BF license shall be a holder of an existing retail alcoholic beverages license issued in the State authorizing the sale of beer, a State Class 5 brewery license, a State Class 6 pub–brewery license, or a State Class 7 micro–brewery license.
A holder of a special BF license shall display and sell only beer that is:

paragraph.text: Manufactured and processed in any state;
Price filed in accordance with regulations adopted by the Comptroller;
Distributed in the State at the time the application is filed; and
Sold at retail on the days and for the hours designated for the festival for consumption on or off the licensed premises.

subsection.text: The license fee is $15.
This section does not prohibit the holder of a special BF license from holding another alcoholic beverages license of a different class or nature.
The Alcoholic Beverage Board of St. Mary’s County shall:

paragraph.text: Approve one weekend annually for the beer festival that does not fall on the dates chosen for the Sotterley Wine Festival;
Approve a location in Historic St. Mary’s City for this festival; and
Ensure that the primary focuses of the festival are both the promotion of Maryland beer and tourism in Historic St. Mary’s City.

subsection.text: The Alcoholic Beverage Board of St. Mary’s County shall adopt regulations for carrying out this section.
This section applies only in Carroll County.
In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners.
The Board may approve the issuance of a beer tasting (BT) alcoholic beverages license.
The license may be issued only to holders of a beer, wine and liquor (BWL) or a beer and wine (BW) license.

The license permits the consumption of beer authorized to be sold by the beer, wine and liquor license (BWL) or the beer and wine license (BW) for tasting or sampling purposes only. Consideration may not be charged or exacted.
The Board shall regulate:

paragraph.text: The quantity of beer to be served to each person;
The number of bottles or other containers of beer from which this quantity is being served; and
The size of the bottles or other containers.

subsection.text: The annual license fee:

paragraph.text: For holders of a BWL license is $100 in addition to the cost of the BWL license; and
For holders of a BW license is $100 in addition to the cost of the BW license.

subsection.text: The Board may adopt regulations providing additional requirements to implement this section.
This section applies only in Washington County.
In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners.
The Board may issue a beer tasting (BT) alcoholic beverages license.
The license may be issued only to a holder of a Class A or Class B beer and wine (BW) license or a Class A or Class B beer, wine and liquor (BWL) license in the county.

paragraph.text: The BT license permits the consumption of beer for tasting purposes only.
To hold a beer tasting, a holder of the BT license shall provide beer to consumers at no charge.

subsection.text: The Board shall regulate:

paragraph.text: The quantity of beer to be served to each person;
The number of bottles or other containers of beer from which this quantity is being served; and
The size of the bottles or other containers.
The annual BT license fee is $100.
The fee is in addition to the BW license fee or the BWL license fee.

subsection.text: The Board may adopt regulations to carry out this section.
This section applies only in Carroll County.
In this section, “Board” means the Board of License Commissioners for Carroll County.
The Board may approve the issuance of a liquor tasting license.
The liquor tasting license may be issued only to holders of a Class A beer, wine and liquor license.

paragraph.text: The liquor tasting license authorizes the consumption of liquor authorized to be sold by the beer, wine and liquor license holder for tasting or sampling purposes only.
To hold a liquor tasting, a holder of a liquor tasting license shall provide liquor to consumers at no charge.

subsection.text: A person may consume liquor at a liquor tasting in a quantity not exceeding:

paragraph.text: One–half ounce from a single sample of liquor; and
Five samples in a single day.

subsection.text: The annual fee for the liquor tasting license is $100.
A liquor tasting license is valid for not more than 52 days a year and may be used on consecutive or nonconsecutive days.
The Board may adopt regulations to carry out this section.
In this section, “district” means:

paragraph.text: A designated Maryland main street with a local management authority;
A designated revitalization area; or
An area with a revitalization plan that has been adopted locally.

subsection.text: This section applies only in Prince George’s County.
There is a Class B-RD license.

paragraph.text: A Class B-RD (revitalization district) license shall be issued by the office where Class B licenses are issued in the county.
The license authorizes the holder to keep for sale and sell liquor at retail in any premises licensed for Class B-RD sales.
Only on-sale consumption is permitted.

subsection.text: The annual license fee is $725.
All applicants for this license shall:

paragraph.text: Be located and remain within a district;
Have gross sales:

subparagraph.text: That do not exceed $150,000 per year; and
Of which at least 80 percent are derived from the sale of food; and

paragraph.text: Be primarily a restaurant at which patrons are seated to eat.

subsection.text: The hours and days for sale are as provided in § 11-517 of this article.
The Board of License Commissioners shall determine the number of Class B-RD (revitalization district) licenses to be issued.

A license may not be issued to a partnership, to a corporation, or to a limited liability company, but only to individuals authorized to act for a partnership, corporation, or limited liability company who shall assume all responsibilities as individuals, and be subject to all of the penalties, conditions and restrictions imposed upon licensees under the provisions of the Tax – General Article that relate to the alcoholic beverage tax and the provisions of this article. If the application is made for a partnership, the license shall be applied for and be issued to all the partners as individuals, all of whom shall have resided in the city or county in which the place of business is located for at least 2 years prior to the application.

subparagraph.text: In Montgomery County, if the application is made for a partnership, the license shall be applied for and issued to at least 2 general partners as individuals, at least one of whom is a registered voter of the county where the application is made and resides there at the time of the application. If there is only one general partner, the license shall be issued to that partner as an individual, if that partner is a registered voter of the county where the application is made and resides there at the time of application.

sub-subparagraph.text: In Baltimore County, if the application is made for a partnership, the license shall be applied for and issued to at least two general partners as individuals, at least one of whom is a registered voter of any county of the State or of the City of Baltimore and resides there at the time of application.

If there is only one general partner, the Board of License Commissioners shall issue the license to that partner as an individual, if the partner is a registered voter of any county or of the City of Baltimore and resides there at the time of the application.
The provisions of this subparagraph may not be construed to waive any of the requirements under §§ 9–102, 9–102.2, and 9–301 of this article.

paragraph.text: In Harford County, the applicant shall be a bona fide resident of Harford County for at least 1 year before filing the application and shall remain a resident as long as the license is in effect. The applicant is not required to be a registered voter.

In Prince George’s County, if an application is made for a sole proprietorship or partnership, the license shall be applied for and issued to all partners as individuals, all of whom shall have resided in Prince George’s County for at least 2 years prior to the application, are registered voters in Prince George’s County, and shall continue to be bona fide residents of Prince George’s County as long as the license is in effect.

sub-subparagraph.text: In Frederick County, if an alcoholic beverages license application is made for a partnership, the license shall be applied for and issued to 3 individuals.

None of the 3 individuals need to be partners. However, all 3 individuals shall be authorized in writing to act for the partnership by making application for and becoming holders of the license for partnership.
Of the 3 individuals, 1 shall be a registered voter at the time of application and prior thereto and be a resident of Frederick County for at least 2 years prior to making application.
The names of all of the partners shall be stated on the application.

subparagraph.text: If a corporation, partnership, or limited liability company is a partner of the partnership for which application is being made, the applicants shall state on the application:

sub-subparagraph.text: The name of any owner of more than 33 percent of the stock in the corporate partner;
The name of any owner of more than 33 percent of ownership interest of the partnership partner; or
The name of any member with more than a 33 percent interest in the limited liability company partner.

subparagraph.text: This paragraph (5) applies only to licenses issued by the State Comptroller.
If a license application is made for a partnership, the license shall be issued to three individuals, each of whom shall qualify as follows:

sub-subparagraph.text: An individual general partner; or
When a general partner is a corporation, an officer of the corporation as an individual.

subparagraph.text: If less than three general partners or corporate officers exist, then a license may be issued to all of the general partners or officers qualified under subparagraph (ii)2 of this paragraph.
In each instance under this paragraph, at least one of the applicants shall be:

sub-subparagraph.text: A resident of the State for at least 2 years preceding the filing of the applications; and
A registered voter of the State.

subparagraph.text: This paragraph may not be construed to waive any of the requirements under § 9–102 of this article.
This paragraph applies only in Wicomico County.

sub-subparagraph.text: If a stadium beer and light wine license application is made for a partnership, the license shall be applied for and issued to three individuals.

None of the three individuals need be partners. However, all three individuals shall be authorized in writing to act for the partnership by making application for and becoming holders of the license for the partnership.

Of the three individuals, one shall be a registered voter at the time of application and for 1 year prior to then and be a resident of Wicomico County for at least 2 years prior to making application.
The names of all of the partners shall be stated on the application.

subparagraph.text: If a corporation, partnership, or limited liability company is a partner of the partnership for which application is being made, the applicants shall state on the application:

sub-subparagraph.text: The name of any owner of more than 33 percent of the stock in the corporate partner;
The name of any owner of more than 33 percent of ownership interest of the partnership partner; or
The name of any member with more than 33 percent interest in the limited liability company partner.

subsection.text: If the application is made for a corporation, or a club, whether incorporated or unincorporated, the license shall be applied for by and be issued to three of the officers of that corporation or club, as individuals, for the use of the corporation or club, at least one of whom shall be a registered voter and taxpayer of the county or city, or State of Maryland when the application is filed with the Comptroller, and shall also have resided therein, at least two years prior to the application. The application shall also set forth the names and addresses of all of the officers of the corporation or club and shall be signed by the president or vice president, as well as by three officers to whom the license shall be issued. The application for every license shall disclose the name and address of the corporation, partnership or association, as well as the name and address of the applicant. For an application for any Class E, Class F or Class G license, the application may be made by any three officers or employees residing in this State, duly authorized by the corporation to apply for the license. The provisions of this subsection with reference to an applicant being a registered voter, taxpayer or resident of the State of Maryland do not apply when three principal officers of a corporation make application for a Class G license. This section does not apply to “racetrack licenses” or to “beach and amusement park licenses” issued in Anne Arundel County. In the case of a corporation where there are less than three officers or directors of the corporation, all officers or directors shall make the application as provided in this section. In the event there are no officers or directors of a close corporation, at least one stockholder may make the application as provided in this section, if there is an affirmative vote of the stockholders holding a majority of the stock.

subparagraph.text: Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, if the application is made for a limited liability company, the license shall be applied for by and be issued to 3 of the authorized persons of that limited liability company, as individuals, for the use of the limited liability company, at least 1 of whom shall be a registered voter and taxpayer of the county or city, or the State when the application is filed with the Comptroller, and shall also have resided there at least 2 years before the application.

In Baltimore City, an authorized person of a limited liability company who holds an alcoholic beverages license for the use of the limited liability company that was granted on or before June 1, 2012, need not be a registered voter in Baltimore City.

paragraph.text: The application shall also set forth the names and addresses of each of the authorized persons and shall be signed by the 3 authorized persons to whom the license shall be issued.

subparagraph.text: The application for each license shall disclose the name and address of the limited liability company and the name and address of the applicant.

Notwithstanding item (i) of this paragraph, in the case of an application for Class E, Class F, or Class G license, the application may be made by any 3 authorized persons or employees residing in the State, duly authorized by the limited liability company to apply for the license.

paragraph.text: The provisions of this subsection with reference to an applicant being a registered voter, taxpayer, or resident of the State do not apply when 3 members of a limited liability company make application for a Class G license.

subparagraph.text: Nothing in this section shall apply to “racetrack licenses” or to “beach and amusement park licenses” issued in Anne Arundel County.

In the case of a limited liability company in which there are less than 3 authorized persons of the limited liability company, all authorized persons shall make the application as provided in this section.

paragraph.text: This subsection applies only in Prince George’s County.

If the application is made for a corporation or a club, whether incorporated or unincorporated, or for a limited liability company, the license shall be applied for by and be issued to 3 of the officers of a corporation or club, or 3 of the authorized persons of a limited liability company, as individuals, for the use of the corporation, club, or limited liability company.

In addition to the provisions of subsection (a)(3) of this section, a license may not be issued, renewed, or transferred to an individual applying on behalf of a corporation, unincorporated association, or limited liability company, unless bona fide residents of Prince George’s County own 25 percent of the total issued capital stock of the corporation or unincorporated association or 25 percent of the interests of the limited liability company, as the case may be.
The application for a license shall:

subparagraph.text: Set forth the names and addresses of all the officers of the corporation or club or of all the authorized persons of a limited liability company;
Be signed by the president or vice president of a corporation or club or the 3 officers or authorized persons, as the case may be, to whom the license is issued;
Disclose the name and address of the corporation, club, partnership, association, or limited liability company as well as the names and addresses of the applicants; and

In the case of a corporation where there are less than 3 officers or directors of the corporation, or in the case of a limited liability company where there are less than 3 authorized persons, all officers, directors, or authorized persons, as the case may be, shall make the application.

paragraph.text: If a close corporation has no officers or directors, in order to make the application:

subparagraph.text: At least 25 percent of the stock shall be held by Prince George’s County residents;
There shall be an affirmative vote of the stockholders holding a majority of the stock;
At least 1 stockholder shall apply for the license as provided in this section; and

The applicants or the corporation shall furnish annually to the Board of License Commissioners a sworn statement giving the name and address of each stockholder of the corporation and the number of shares that each stockholder owns in his name on which he has a right to vote at any stockholder meeting.

paragraph.text: This section does not apply to racetrack licenses, Class BLX licenses, arena licenses, Class BCE (catering) licenses, Class B–CC (convention center) licenses, Class B/ECF (educational conference facility) licenses, issuance, renewal, or transfer of Class B–DD (development district) licenses, or to businesses whose sales of stock or interests are authorized for sale by the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States.
Current licensees shall comply with the provisions of this section by July 1, 1985.

In Howard County the applicants for a new license or the transfer of an existing license for the use of a corporation or limited liability company shall certify that the following requirements shall be maintained as long as the licensee is the holder of the license:

subparagraph.text: That the qualifying individual owns a minimum of 10 percent of the stock in the corporation or interest in the limited liability company; or

That the qualifying individual shall serve as the manager or supervisor and shall be physically present on a full–time basis at the licensed premises to conduct the daily business involving transactions concerning alcoholic beverages sales.

paragraph.text: The stock or interest ownership requirement provided for in paragraph (1) of this subsection does not apply:

subparagraph.text: To a corporation for which shares of stock or a limited liability company for which interests are authorized for sale by the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States; or

To a corporation in which a majority of the shares of stock or a limited liability company in which a majority of the interests are owned or controlled either directly or indirectly by one or more corporations or limited liability companies whose shares of stock or interests are so traded.

paragraph.text: The corporations and limited liability companies provided for in paragraph (2) of this subsection shall maintain one applicant as a manager or supervisor physically present on a full–time basis at the licensed premises to conduct the daily business involving transactions concerning alcoholic beverages sales.

Individuals applying for a license on behalf of corporations or limited liability companies shall submit an executed copy of the articles of incorporation or articles of organization, as the case may be, and a schedule showing names, addresses, and percentages of all stockholders holding a minimum of 5 percent of the shares of stock of a corporation or of all members holding a minimum of 5 percent of the interests of a limited liability company. The schedule requirement shall not apply in the case of a corporation whose shares of stock or a limited liability company whose interests are authorized for sale by the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States.

In Queen Anne’s County, a beer, wine and liquor license, Class A (off–sale) may not be issued to an individual for the use of a partnership, corporation, or limited liability company unless the owners of 75 percent of the total issued capital stock or interests of the partnership, corporation, or limited liability company are bona fide residents of Queen Anne’s County, and have been bona fide residents of the county for two years next preceding the application for this license.
The qualifying corporation under this subsection may not have more than 1 class of common stock authorized by its charter.

In Queen Anne’s County, an applicant for an alcoholic beverage license to be issued for the benefit of a corporation or limited liability company is not required to be a resident of Queen Anne’s County. However, each applicant applying on behalf of a corporation or limited liability company shall be a resident of the State of Maryland and the owner of not less than 15 percent of the total outstanding shares of common stock of the corporation or 15 percent of the interests of the limited liability company which would be entitled to vote at any meeting of stockholders or members. The qualifying corporation under this subsection may not have more than 1 class of common stock authorized by its charter. The provisions of this paragraph do not apply to Class A beer, wine and liquor licenses.

In addition, the applicants or the corporation or limited liability company shall furnish annually to the Board of License Commissioners a sworn statement giving the name and address of each stockholder of the corporation and the number of shares that each stockholder owns in his name on which he has a right to vote at any stockholder meeting, or the name and address of each member of the limited liability company and interest that each member owns in the member’s name on which the member has a right to vote at a meeting of members.
The Board of License Commissioners may require any other data and information regarding the background and prior activities of the applicants as it considers necessary.
This subsection does not apply to or affect any license issued prior to May 1, 1976.
The following license requirements do not apply when granting a Class B beer, wine and liquor on–sale license for use in a conference center:

subparagraph.text: The residency requirement under paragraph (1) of this subsection;
The ownership requirement under paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
The annual sworn statement requirement under paragraph (2) of this subsection.

subsection.text: In Wicomico County, a Class A (off–sale) beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued to an individual or partnership unless they have a Class B (on–sale) beer, wine and liquor restaurant 7–day license and have been in operation for not less than 3 months prior to the application for the license. A Class A (off–sale) beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued to any corporation or limited liability company unless the applicants (1) own or are owners of 75 percent of the total issued capital stock of the corporation or the limited liability company, as the case may be, and (2) have a Class B (on–sale) beer, wine and liquor restaurant 7–day license, and (3) have been in operation for not less than 3 months prior to the application for the license.

paragraph.text: In Worcester County, an alcoholic beverage license, except a Class B beer, wine and liquor license, may not be issued to a corporation or limited liability company unless one of the applicants has been a registered voter, a taxpayer and a resident of Worcester County and owns at least 10 percent of the total issued capital stock of the corporation or 10 percent of the interests of the limited liability company, as the case may be.
Any license holder holding a license issued prior to May 1, 1977 is exempt from this subsection.

In addition, the applicants for the corporation or limited liability company shall furnish the Board of License Commissioners a sworn statement giving the name and address of each stockholder of the corporation or member of the limited liability company and the number of voting shares that each stockholder or member owns.

In Cecil County, if a license is issued to individuals as officers of a corporation or authorized persons of a limited liability company and there is a change in 1 or more officers of a corporation or authorized persons of a limited liability company, the corporation or limited liability company, as the case may be, shall provide written notice by certified mail to the Board of License Commissioners within 30 days after installation of the new officers or authorized persons.

The written notice furnished by the corporation or limited liability company to the Board of License Commissioners shall be accompanied by a $5 fee and a sworn statement giving the name and address of each new officer or authorized person, the office held, and the previous officer’s or authorized person’s name and address.

Upon receipt of written notification of a change in corporate officers or authorized persons of a limited liability company, the Board of License Commissioners shall issue a revised license listing the individuals as current officers of the corporation or current authorized persons of the limited liability company.

subsection.text: In Harford County, if the application is made for a corporation, whether incorporated or unincorporated or for a limited liability company:

paragraph.text: Application for the license shall be by and be issued to 3 of the officers holding a pecuniary interest in the corporation or 3 of the authorized persons holding a pecuniary interest in the limited liability company, as individuals, for the use of the corporation or limited liability company, as the case may be.

In addition to the provisions of paragraph (1) of this subsection, 1 of the applicants shall be a bona fide resident of the county and the license shall remain valid only so long as the resident applicant remains a resident of the county.
The resident applicant shall:

subparagraph.text: Own at least 25 percent of the total business. Except in the case of an applicant for a Class B (beer, wine and liquor) license, the resident applicant shall own at least 10 percent of the total business;
Serve as manager or supervisor; and
Be physically present on the premises a substantial amount of time on a daily basis.

paragraph.text: Paragraph (3) of this subsection relating to resident applicants applies to any license issued or transferred after July 1, 1984.
The application for a license shall:

subparagraph.text: Set forth the names and addresses of all the officers of the corporation or authorized persons of the limited liability company;
Be signed by the president or vice president of a corporation and the 3 officers of a corporation or the 3 authorized persons of a limited liability company to whom the license is issued; and
Disclose the name and address of the corporation, partnership, association, or limited liability company, as well as the names and addresses of the applicants.

In the case of a corporation where there are less than 3 officers or directors of the corporation or in the case of a limited liability company where there are less than 3 authorized persons, all officers or directors holding a pecuniary interest in the corporation, or all authorized persons holding a pecuniary interest in the limited liability company shall make the application.
In the case of a close corporation where there are no officers or directors, 1 or more resident, majority stockholders may make the application as provided for in this subsection.
In this paragraph “owner” means a person who has a real, provable financial interest in the business and includes a stockholder or managerial employee of the actual owner.
Stock ownership requirements do not apply to an applicant for a Class B hotel or restaurant beer, wine and liquor license or a Class BNR beer, wine and liquor license in which:

sub-subparagraph.text: A majority of the shares of stock are owned or controlled either directly or indirectly by 1 or more corporations whose shares of stock are authorized for sale by the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States;
At least 1 of the licensees is a resident operator of the business conducted on the licensed premises and that same individual is responsible for the day to day operation of the license;
All licensees, including the resident applicant, are named officers of the corporation; and
The residency requirement in effect at the time the license is issued remains in effect as long as the license is in effect.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, in Charles County, an applicant for a new license for the use of a corporation or limited liability company or a transfer of an existing license for the use of a corporation or limited liability company shall certify to the Board of License Commissioners that the applicant:

subparagraph.text: Is an officer of the corporation or limited liability company;
Meets each of the other applicable qualifications for licensure under this section;
Owns 20 percent of the stock in that corporation or a 20 percent interest in the limited liability company; and
Will maintain a 20 percent interest in the corporation or limited liability company as long as the applicant is the holder of the license.

paragraph.text: The ownership requirement in paragraph (1) of this subsection does not apply to an applicant who applies for a Class BLX license for the use of a corporation or limited liability company in which:

subparagraph.text: Shares of stock of a corporation or interests in a limited liability company are authorized for sale by the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States; or

A majority of the shares of stock of the corporation or interests in the limited liability company are owned or controlled either directly or indirectly by one or more corporations or limited liability companies, the shares of stock or the interests in which are authorized for sale by the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States.

paragraph.text: Applicants for a license for the use of a corporation or limited liability company shall submit to the Board of License Commissioners:

subparagraph.text: An executed copy of the articles of incorporation or articles of organization, as the case may be; and

A schedule showing names, addresses, and percentages of all stockholders holding a minimum of 5 percent of the shares of stock of a corporation or members holding a minimum of 5 percent of the interests of a limited liability company.

paragraph.text: The schedule requirement under paragraph (3)(ii) of this subsection does not apply if the corporation’s shares of stock or the limited liability company’s interests are authorized for sale by the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States.
This subsection applies only in Calvert County.
The name or names of the person or persons who own the greatest number of shares in the corporation which makes application for a license shall appear on the application as applicants.
The applicant who is a resident of the county shall own at least 10 percent of the business.
These requirements are in addition to any other requirements imposed by this article.

No more than one license provided by this article, except by way of renewal or as otherwise provided in this section, shall be issued in any county or Baltimore City, to any person, or for the use of any partnership, corporation, unincorporated association, or limited liability company, in Baltimore City or any county of the State.
No more than one license shall be issued for the same premises except as provided in §§ 2–201 through 2–208, 2–301, and 6–701 and Title 7.5 of this article.

This subsection may not be construed to apply to § 6–201(r)(4), (15), (17), and (18), § 7–101(b) and (c), § 8–202(g)(2)(ii) and (iii), § 8–217(e), § 8–508, § 8–902, § 9–217(b–1), or § 12–202 of this article.

subsection.text: A Class A, B, or D beer license, beer and wine license, or beer, wine and liquor license, except by way of renewal, may not be granted, transferred, or issued to, or for use in conjunction with, or upon the premises of any business establishment of the type commonly known as chain stores, supermarkets, or discount houses. This subsection does not apply to or affect any business establishment already holding such a license or the possibility of such licensee having the license transferred to a similar type of business establishment. Discount houses do not include licensees who sell at discount prices.
Repealed.

paragraph.text: The provisions of subsection (a) of this section do not apply to licenses issued:

subparagraph.text: Under § 3–401 or § 5–401 of this article for premises operated as a bowling establishment having 30 lanes or more with automatic pinsetters; or
In Montgomery County only, under § 5–202 of this article for premises operated as a bowling establishment having 30 lanes or more with automatic pinsetters.

paragraph.text: The provisions of this subsection do not apply to the following counties:

subparagraph.text: Baltimore;
Carroll;
Frederick;
Howard;
Prince George’s, except as to paragraph (3) of this subsection; and
Worcester.

paragraph.text: In Prince George’s County, the provisions of subsection (a) of this section do not apply to licenses issued to such bowling establishments prior to June 1, 1982. These provisions do not authorize the issuance of new or additional licenses in violation of subsection (a) of this section.

Notwithstanding any other provisions of this section, in Baltimore City the holder of a Class B (on–sale –– hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor license under this article, by making application in the regular manner and paying the usual fee, may obtain additional Class B (on–sale –– hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor licenses for premises operated as a public hotel and having one hundred or more rooms, or as an apartment house having one hundred fifty or more apartments, provided, however, that no apartment house licensee may obtain or hold at any one time more than three Class B (on–sale –– hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor licenses, and that no public hotel licensee may obtain or hold at any one time more than five Class B (on–sale –– hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor licenses.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, and subject to the provisions of paragraph (3) of this subsection, in Baltimore City a license of any class may be transferred to the holder of, and for use at the same location as, another existing license.
Paragraph (2) of this subsection shall apply only if:

subparagraph.text: There are no prohibitions specified in this article applicable to the new license at the location in which the license is to be transferred;
The existing license at the location is held in inoperative status as determined by the Board of License Commissioners of Baltimore City; and

The existing license at the location is revoked 180 days after the effective date of the transfer of the new license unless it is transferred to a new holder and location as approved by the Board of License Commissioners.

paragraph.text: In Allegany County, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued, except by way of renewal, to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverages license in any other state or in Washington, D.C.

In Anne Arundel County, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued except by way of renewal to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverage license in any other state or in Washington, D.C.

In Baltimore City, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued except by way of renewal to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverage license in any other state.

In Baltimore County, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued, except by way of renewal, to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverages license in any other state or in Washington, D.C.

In Calvert County and St. Mary’s County, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued, except by way of renewal, to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverages license in any other state or in Washington, D.C.

In Charles County, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued, except by way of renewal, to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverages license in any other state or in Washington, D.C.

In Garrett County, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued, except by way of renewal, to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverages license in any other state or in Washington, D.C.

In Howard County, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued, except by way of renewal, to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverages license in any other state or in Washington, D.C.

In Washington County, a Class A or Class D beer, beer and light wine, or beer, wine and liquor license may not be issued, except by way of renewal, to a person, corporation, or limited liability company holding an alcoholic beverages license in any other state or in Washington, D.C.

Notwithstanding any other provisions of this section, and subject to subsections (b–3B) and (b–3C) of this section, in Baltimore City or Baltimore County, the holder of a Class B, (on–sale –– hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor license under this article, by making application in the regular manner and paying the usual fee may obtain an additional Class B, (on–sale –– hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor license for premises used and occupied as a bona fide restaurant, as may be defined by the rules and regulations of the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City or Baltimore County, provided that said restaurant has a minimum capital investment of $500,000 for restaurant facilities, which sum shall not include the cost of land or buildings, and has a minimum seating capacity of 125 persons.

Nothing contained herein shall permit the issuance of more than five such licenses to any person, or for the use of any partnership, corporation, unincorporated association, or limited liability company in Baltimore City or Baltimore County.

The granting of additional licenses hereunder shall be limited and restricted to the purpose of providing alcoholic beverages for consumption on the licensed premises only, with no off–sale privileges to be exercised therewith.

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section or § 8–204(l) of this article, in Baltimore County, an individual or a sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, unincorporated association, or limited liability company in the county, may obtain a direct or indirect interest in:

subparagraph.text: Not more than 12 Class B (on–sale –– hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor licenses under this article; or

If one of the restaurants for which a license is issued is located in the Liberty Road Commercial Revitalization District in accordance with subsection (b–3C) of this section, not more than 13 Class B (on–sale — hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor licenses under this article.

paragraph.text: For an applicant to obtain a license under this subsection:

subparagraph.text: The applicant shall apply in the regular manner and pay the usual fee; and
The restaurants for which the licenses are sought shall:

sub-subparagraph.text: Meet the requirements of the rules and regulations of the Board of License Commissioners regarding the availability and issuance of licenses;
Meet the definition requirements of “restaurant” established under the regulations of the Board of License Commissioners;
Have a minimum seating capacity of 190 persons for dining;
Have a cocktail lounge or bar area seating capacity that does not exceed 25% of the seating capacity for dining; and
Have no more than 40% of sales in alcoholic beverages in connection with the business.

paragraph.text: An indirect interest is presumed to exist between two individuals, corporations, limited liability companies, partnerships, limited partnerships, joint ventures, associations, or other combination of persons, if they:

subparagraph.text: Have a common parent company;
Are parties to a franchise agreement, licensing agreement, or concession agreement;
Are part of a chain of businesses that is commonly owned and operated;
Share a director, stockholder, partner, or member;
Share a director, stockholder, partner, or member of a parent or subsidiary;
Share, directly or indirectly, profit from the sale of alcoholic beverages; or
Share a trade name, trademark, logo or theme, or mode of operation identifiable by the public.

paragraph.text: Off–sale privileges may not be conferred by these licenses.

subparagraph.text: Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, nothing contained in this section may be construed to authorize the issuance of more than six licenses to an individual or a sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, unincorporated association, or limited liability company in the county under this article, including Class B (on–sale –– hotels and restaurants), Class B (SB) restaurant — service bar beer, wine and liquor (on–sale), Class B (TTC) restaurant beer, wine and liquor (on–sale), and Class BDR (deluxe restaurant) (on–sale) beer, wine and liquor licenses.

The Board of License Commissioners may issue a seventh license to a person if the license is for a restaurant located in the Liberty Road Commercial Revitalization District in accordance with subsection (b–3C) of this section.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section or § 8–204(l) of this article, in Baltimore County, an individual or a sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, unincorporated association, or limited liability company in the county, may obtain a direct or indirect interest in not more than 13 Class B (on–sale — hotels and restaurants) beer, wine and liquor licenses under this article, by making application in the regular manner and paying the usual fee if the restaurant for which the additional license is sought:

subparagraph.text: Meets the requirements of the rules and regulations of the Board of License Commissioners regarding the availability and issuance of licenses;
